results.description:
We are a Montclair- based community-wide coalition of local groups, organizations, and businesses focused on making healthy the easy choice. Bike&Walk(BWM)  and Eat. Play. Live...Better (EPLB) share the goal of improving and increasing active transportation in Montclair and surrounding areas. We advocate for safe, enjoyable and convenient walking and biking.   BWM and EPLB’s relationship's with all our partners will help further our common goals and help create vital, connected neighborhoods. 

The Bike & Walk with Us  Program is designed to support and encourage individuals to walk and/or bike together to improve health, enjoy our local parks or walk/bike to local business. Walking is the number one activity people report for getting the recommended amount of physical activity. Walking/biking with friends and colleagues helps you stay motivated and continue  a life-long health behavior. This is a group for anyone interested in walking, biking, being social and advocating for bike & pedestrian safety. 

Our strength as an advocacy organization grows with the size of our membership; the more people we represent, the more clout and credibility we have. 

Making your neighborhoods better for walking & biking is about more than better footpaths and crossings or lower speed limits. It is also about building friendly streets, getting people to walk & bike more and a whole of things you can do to help.  

Support from our members ensures our financial sustainability and allows us to:

·  Continue to innovate and make our streets a safe place for everyone.

·  Host more events for more people every year

·  Take on bigger issues and better serve our community.

Help make our voice heard. Become a member today email liz.brady13@gmail.com for more information. 

Join Bike&Walk Montclair and help make your streets better for walking and biking.

We look forward to a world in which people choose to travel in ways that benefit their health and environment

Thank you and good luck !
Siris Amsterdam

results.description:
Who We Are

The YONY/Rivertowns Creative Meetup is dedicated to accelerating an emerging creative and tech business corridor along the Hudson River in Westchester County that is transforming our former industrial waterfronts and downtowns into economic generators once again. Our mission is to inspire with the insight of creative leaders, to establish connections with people and resources to help our members flourish, and to promote the clustering of tech and other creative industries in Downtown Yonkers and communities along the Hudson.

This Meetup is presented by YONY Initiative, Inc., Sarah Lawrence College and The City of Yonkers.

Who Should Join?

Our goal is to build community and expand opportunity by hosting the Lower Hudson Valley’s ultimate networking event for those who are passionate about tech, biotech, green tech, new media, social marketing, digital design, e-publishing, start-ups, finance, economic development, urban planning, architecture, public policy, advocacy, writing, the commercial and fine arts, and the full array of knowledge industries that are being transformed by technological innovation.

Our Monthly Event

We will meet each month at the Yonkers Riverfront Library, a growing cultural and social hub in the region.  The Meetup will include a catered networking reception followed by a talk with a prominent creative leader, concluding with an audience Q&A session.  The networking will continue at an after-party at a nearby local restaurant.

This group is about a new and different kind of FUN! You believe in fun too, don't you?

What a great city this is, including its potential for much more. This meetup creates a space where we can join together to make it even more happy and healthy. Our main meeting place is easy to find between City Hall and the Mount Vernon East station.

When we connect to learn how to intentionally focus our conscious thoughts on how we would like this town to blossom into 2014, we create a powerful force for good. We will: 
-learn powerful but simple techniques to knock out serious problems, e.g., depression, PTSD, addictions and phobias. 
-seek to contribute to a loving environment which is where the deepest healing happens. 
-practice communication tools that are based on respect and empathy (aka Non-Violent Communication).
-share our ideas, ways of coping, and questions about anything impacting the quality of life for the community, our families, or our selves.

results.description:
This is a John of God in Brazil support group connecting people in New York area.  We provide Casa Meditation gathering for people who have seen John of God, and information events for people who have not seen him guiding how to receive his magical healing work . 

The main purpose of this group was established, for not to forget what we learned at the casa, the magical possibilities we witnessed there, and bring that loving energy back to our everyday lives.  Yet healing takes time and we go through different spiritual experiences that we can not understand and we are not able to talk to everyday people.  It's not easy going through all by yourself.

The founder/organizer Kumi simply wanted to create a space so we can talk about our experiences and support each other.  Wanted to make the experience of Abadiania not only a wonderful memory, but to bring the love and joy back here, because the reason we John of God is to be happy here at home. 

Kumi visited Abadiania the first time in April of 2013 more from a curiosity, then she met "Spirituality".  She flew back in August of 2013 again to find out more.  When she returned from Abadiania, she decided to take her spiritual path with John of God and the entities of Casa de Dom Inacio de Loyola.  Her commitment established the group, John of God Brazil - New York Community in November of 2013.  In April 2014 she returned to the Casa and informed the Casa administration about the group and received blessings from John of God.  

The meditation gathering is for people who have been to Abadiania or have seen John of God, also for those of you who received distance healing.  The group is now giving events for people who have not seen John of God and interested in learning and seeing him.  There are many ways and protocols to receive healing from John of God we are happy to provide what is waiting for you.     

The group is still small but the energy we've been creating is powerful and beautiful.  Come join us and let's continue the healing.  Share the love, joy and happiness of Abadiania!

Love & Light

Kumi

clarakumi7@gmail.com
results.name: John of God Brazil - New York Community

results.description:
I originally titled this meetup "How to Compute Anything," as a play on Douglas Hubbard's book "How to Measure Anything: Finding the Value of Intangibles in Business." I'm interested in meeting game changers (including analysts, scientists, engineers, mathematicians) who want to understand, instrument, and change the world.

I want to go beyond vanity metrics, to measure and impact real things I really care about. I think computers can make that easier, by crawling data, collecting human judgments, and closing the loop.

Everyone, from people who spend their workday in Excel, to hardcore computer scientists and statisticians, are welcome.

Presentations on personal projects or stuff you're learning are welcome and appreciated. Research, not-for-profit, and business presentations and sponsors are welcome if your organization explicitly and reflectively measures and influences "intangibles" in a closed loop (which can involve humans and human judgment, because reality is messy).

So, let's meet up and exchange ideas, argue for optimal leverage points, synthesize cares and concerns, and start building stuff. Finally, we all care, but we also all have lives: Let's orient towards systems, leverage, and timeboxing vs heroics.


• How to Measure Anything [Amazon]

• A Guide to Actionable Measurement [Gates Foundation; pdf]

• Effective Altruism [Wikipedia]

• Bill Gates: My Plan to Fix The World's Biggest Problems [WSJ]

• Why Software Is Eating The World [WSJ]

• Seeing Like A State [Amazon]
results.name: Computing Good

results.description:
Musa Muhaiyaddeen (E. L. Levin) has a rare gift for making the teachings of Sufism accessible to westerners and teaches in a very grounded way, distilling esoteric concepts into useable and understandable language. Musa is a direct disciple of the Sufi Saint Bawa Muhaiyaddeen. As Musa explains, Sufism goes beyond all languages, religions and cultural backgrounds. This is a path open to all seekers of the unseen, those striving to connect to their spiritual inner life, to give new meaning and direction that is easily put into practice.

You can hear many of Musa's discourses on his website at www.thewitnesswithin.com. His latest book, The Elixir of Truth: Journey on the Sufi Path, is available through Amazon.com.

To quote Musa, “There is this mystery of man’s relationship to God. Every person has this relationship. We need to explore this relationship, and make that exploration something that is a life-long priority. We identify with our bodies, but we are not our body. Similarly, we identify with our culture, language, religions, but we are not any of these things either. Our true story is the story of our real identity. We need to find what and who that is. Just as we have duties to our family, and within the work-sphere, at the same time we also have to do what is necessary to understand where reality is, and who we are in that reality. That, in fact, is our primary duty.”

A zikr recitation follows every talk and all are invited to join in.

These talks will be given at the New York Open Center, 22 East 30th Street, New York, New York 10016. 

All are welcome to attend, and there is no admission charge.


(Required statement: We are not sponsored by The Open Center)
results.name: Sufi Study Center

Our ballet group is for anyone intrested in movement,dance and improving coordination; balance, posture, musicality and rhythm. Beginners as well as returning adults, all levels are welcome. 

No previous dance experience is necessary for the elementary classes. If you have previous experience the intermediate classes are for you. 

Join our dance meetup for recreation and pleasure, as well as in-depth instruction. If you are looking to balance out the long hours at work with insufficient movement and have a great time; the sheer joy of moving, interpreting the steps, moved by the music, expressing yourself through your body in an artistic and creatively satisfying manner, these classes are for you. 

Many of my students who would not think of exercising at the gym, get many of the same benefits in this enjoyable social setting. They forget the worries and stresses of the day as they focus on coordinating their movements to the music. 

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance, and provides a complete full-body workout. 

Physical Benefits: 

• Sculpts and tones your body 

• Decreases excess body fat 

• Strengthens the back, the abdominal muscles and the rest of the bodies core muscles 

• Promotes flexibility and range of motion 

• A stronger and more graceful gait 

• Can reduce back pain caused by weak abdominal muscles 

Emotional Benefits: 

• Joy of movement Helps to relieve stress

results.description:
Interested in keeping up with developments in math? Want to know more about information theory? Want to learn some algorithms, but don't know where to start? Join the group! We'll pick books, papers, and articles about all of these topics, read them, and meet to discuss the topics and have problem solving sessions!  We're all about collaborative learning.  Nobody here is necessarily an expert on what we're reading, but we can all benefit from each others' expertise.

If you come across a book or paper you're interested in going over, please suggest a new meetup!

If you know of a book or paper you think we'd like to read, or that you've been thinking of reading, please add it to the Reading List!

We generally have two types of meetings.  

(1) Short term: We have one-off meetings on papers, algorithms, or interesting work our members think everyone can learn from.  They paper/algorithm meetings are often broken into two meetings. The first meetings usually covers theory, and the second covers application (usually with hands-on examples!).  

(2) Long term: We like really getting into the details of subjects, and what better way than picked up an advanced text?!  We have long-term series of meetings where we cover textbooks cover to cover.  Generally we read a section before the meeting, and then discuss the finer points and work problems.

When we have a book that we're reading, we alternate long-term and short-term meetings week by week.  Otherwise, we just have (roughly every two weeks) our short term meetings.
results.name: Math and Algorithm Reading Group

topics.name: Grief Support for Partners and Spouses

results.description:
Hello and welcome. This group is for anyone who has lost a loved one. It is an open group where you can meet others who understand your pain, loneliness and alienation. This is where you can stop pretending, where you can feel safe being honest about how you feel and know that you are with people who understand without you having to explain.

My intention for this group is to provide a guided approach to grieving - think of this as inexpensive group therapy. Each meeting will focus on an aspect of the grieving process, drawn from my own personal experience and from what has been expressed by many others in the grief support groups that I facilitate which are less structured and purposeful. 

We will explore these through discussion and reflection and sometimes, learn new tools such as meditation techniques, breathing exercises and other strategies to support your healing.

Our meetings will be limited to 8 members to allow for more in depth discussion and adequate time for each person to share.

I have learned that with the right guidance, support, association and personal work, we can travel though grief, learning about ourselves, our relationships with others and the greater whole and become more resilient and more whole than we ever hoped or expected from the tragedy that we have experienced. 

This is what I hope for you.


About Me:

I am a personal consultant, music therapist, grief counselor, entrepreneur and concert violinist. My husband "JP" passed away on December 17th, 2008 from terminal brain cancer. I was his primary carer for almost 3 years. We lived in Australia but after his passing, I came to the US to seek out answers, to rebuild myself and my life, and to understand the purpose for this life experience. 

Now, 5 years on, I am extremely grateful to find myself feeling more joy and peace in my 'beingness' than I ever thought possible. Out of the shadows and sorrow, I find a lightness and purpose that I suspect I may never have found had I not had to endure and transform the pain of my husband's passing. 

JP changed me for the better in life and even more so, in death.
results.name: From grief to transformation

results.description:
“The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.” Augustine of Hippo

She’s a nomad is a group dedicated to the free spirit of women who travel abroad by means of backpacking. Backpacking is a form of low-cost, independent international travel. It can include the use of a backpack or similar luggage that you can carry over long distances; the use of public transport; inexpensive lodging such as youth hostels, cheap hotels a longer duration of the trip than most conventional vacations, potentially for weeks or months; and a strong interest in meeting locals in areas you pass through, absorbing the culture while you see the sights. Backpackers tend to want to experience the world in greater detail, and engineer their trips to make this happen through a slower pace and more communal forms of travel, typically through public transport. So let's get together, swap travel stories, talk about our next trip and meet new friends to travel with. Carpe Diem!

results.description: We meet, talk and share stories -- stories from our real lives and our real experiences. This group is a forum for those concerned with their own health and lifestyle. There are a host of different events all centered around leading a healthy life and being part of a vibrant health community.

We do seminars on stress, sleep, nutrition, exercise and more. We host Healthy Happy Hours. We do 5ks. We focus on having fun and making change in our lives and the lives of others. If you're not a member of this group.. you're missing out!!

-----

Who am I?

I am Alex Mazza a Health Coach, in Manhattan, with clients all around the country. I gained my certification from the MacDonald Center for Obesity Prevention & Education at Villanova University College of Nursing.

I help clients who need to lose weight and keep it off. I also help those who can’t sleep through the night or who have poor sleep habits.

I have been featured in W42ST magazine, Fitness Magazine, in publications throughout Hawaii and the Big Island, and in the international magazine “IDEAL Magazine.”

More info on Team Alex Mazza

results.description:
This group is for women around late 30's to early 50's  looking to make new and lasting female friendships. Whether you are married, divorced, single, have kids or not, one can never have enough girlfriends! If you are young in spirit, like to be active and have fun and are a glass half full kind of girl then come join us! The group is trending toward members in their 40's with a few sophisticated ladies in their 30's.

Events range from meeting for dinner/drinks after work, day and weekend events, day trips and possibly more. Most events will have a limit on attendees so check the calendar often and reserve your spot! Participate as much or as little as you like, but please only RSVP for things you will actually attend.

What this group is not: A venue for women to try and meet relationship partners. If you happen to be at an event and meet someone, great, but that will NEVER be the focus of an event. Events will not include clubs, bar crawls or anything you didn't even enjoy in your 20's and events will not usually go past 10pm. This is also not a group for women looking for a back up plan for a particular evening or as a place holder in case one can't find something better to do and anyone who uses the group in that manner will be removed.

results.description:
"Our History"

 Our meetup.com page was started by me Eddie. I came up with this team name from a comic book called Fear Lord's. I thought the team name was cool and I like their comic books storyline, so therefore I'd decided to name our team F.L = "Fearsome Lords".

 Our motto is simple, "Play hard and Die hard". 

We don't have rules per say instead we have guidelines for our community or just use common sense.

Guideline # (1).Loyalty - Bear true faith and allegiance to or what ever you believe in, the O.S.U., your squad and other Soldiers.

Guideline # (2).Duty - Fulfill your obligations.

Giideline # (3).Respect - Treat people as they should be treated.

Guideline # (4).Selfless Service - Put the welfare of the O.S.U. team, and your subordinates before your own.

Guideline # (5).Honor - Live up to Christ-like values or any higher being you believe in. 

Guidline # (6).Integrity - Do what’s right, legally, biblically and morally.

Guideline # (7).Personal Courage - Face fear, danger, or adversity [physical or moral].

Guideline # (8) Cheaters if caught will face the "IRONMAN" (a firing squad ) and if you continue to cheat your banned from the team

Rule # (9) DO NOT STEAL (if caught you will be banned from the team!).

"Fearsome Lords" Paintball Community goals are to enjoy paintball by play everywhere and anywhere as a private party group.We do enjoy traveling to other paintball fields and organize bus trips if our numbers are strong showing and if not we then just stick to carpools if we can. Our team consists of many professionals with well diverse backgrounds. We're a great bunch of cool guy's and lady's ,so we would to like keep it that way.Our goal is to enjoy this sport by playing speedball,woodsball and magfeed. Hopefully this wl allow all player's to have the opportunity to try each one.

If you do not know about paintball then just come along and we will teach you. You can Google paintball or go to Youtube in order to learn about the sport especially the tactics of woodsball or speedball. 

Check out my Facebook page

https://www.facebook.com/FearsomeLords 

You want to try airsoft go to our second page Fearsome Lords Airsoft team on meetup.com (tip: type airsoft in search box and the change miles to 100 miles instead) or just go to this link below

http://www.meetup.com/Deadline-Force

Thank you for joining and we look forward to meeting you for some fun!
results.name: Welcome to our "Fearsome Lords" Paintball Community!.

results.description:
The vision of this group is undergoing reformation, but generally we will cover a broad spectrum of topics, mainly relating to Lightbody Activation, Awakening and Enlightenment, God-Realization, Unity Consciousness, Healing, Higher Sensory Perception, Multidimensional Awareness, development of higher consciousness abilities, and Lightbody Travel.
                                                                                              -----
Welcome to Lightwalkers of NYC!  The main focus of this group is "Astral Projection" or "Out of body travel".   Neither name, I feel, accurately capture the full range of what happens during, what would be more accurately termed, multi-dimensional travel.

For one, you still (might) use a body - an energy body!  For two, we can go beyond the realms of the Astral.

The Primary Goal of this group is to provide a supportive space for those wishing to cultivate their spiritual nature by utilizing multi-dimensional travel. 

Another Goal (of mine) for this group is to experience group travel - the potential of traveling multidimensionally as a group.  This will require a certain level of preparedness, trustworthiness in all of the members, and dedication to the practice. But be at peace in the place you are at, because this will evolve naturally as a group.

                                                                                             ---

We will focus on developing skills and knowledge to enhance our personal spiritual practice.  This includes energy & consciousness actions, activating and clearing the energy bodies, relaxation, meditation, directing the mind with focused intention, how to retain the information accessed in the finer vibration, and much more.  The real knowledge is gained through practice, and this is what we will Focus upon more than conceptual knowledge (although that has a very useful place too!)

The knowledge and understanding of the higher realms will become clearer as we share and grow together.  I am just as much of an explorer as you, and invite clearer understandings and sharings into the space!

The ability to focus the mind and become the Silent Witness is a state of consciousness that will greatly benefit multidimensional traveling, and will be developed by pursuing this practice.

                                                                                           ---

 In reality, we will be developing many things while practicing multi-dimensional travel.  Life is continuous and inclusive.  This practice opens us to the understanding of Reality beyond physical limitation, and the Reality that Life continues infinitely.  And to the Reality of a Higher Self that knows more than the individual human mind. 

Your exercises and ventures into the higher realms will bring wisdom and clarity back into the physical consciousness. You will begin to integrate the lessons already being learned by you in the finer realms; more fully conscious of the  interaction between your physical self and the Higher Self of God - Your Soul Awareness of I AM.
results.name: Light Walkers of NYC

results.description:
Humanism is a philosophy for the here and now. It maintains that humans have evolved on Earth, that there is no supernatural world to aspire to, and that we give meaning to our own lives. Humanists maintain that we have each other to take responsibility for the resolution of human-made problems, that with compassion, rational thought, justice, and courage we can create a world that benefits all humanity. We are passionately working toward a culture of peace, equality, health, and respect for Earth our home.

The Humanist philosophy respects and embraces the efforts of all caring persons, all faiths, all ethnicities, all traditions, and all nations to improve the perilous conditions of humankind. We value life, family, and the larger family of humanity. We believe in the ethical and peaceful pursuit of individual and community happiness and well being. We come together as a group to share ideas, learn new ways of thinking, and encourage others to do likewise.

Founded in 1974, the Humanist Society of Metropolitan New York (HSMNY), the Corliss Lamont Chapter of the American Humanist Association (AHA),  seeks to promote Humanism and free thought in our community. We affirm our ability to lead meaningful, ethical lives capable of contributing to the greater good of all people. We favor opinions formed on the basis of logic, reason, and empiricism, rather than authority, revelation, or dogma. Our goals are to:

• Provide a forum for mutual and public learning and improvement
• Form a warm, supportive community of like-minded people
• Counter the forces in our society that divide us and imperil our world

We welcome all who wish to participate. Join us.

For more information, visit our website at http://www.corliss-lamont.org/hsmny/
results.name: Humanist Society of Metropolitan New York

All breeds & ages are welcome! We plan on meeting at various local parks, in Rockland and Bergen, when the weather is nice. We’ll Walk, Hike, hold Yappy Hours, go to the Beach, have Ice Cream Socials, Birthday Parties, go on Field trips & much more!

results.description:
Q:  Why should I join this group?

A:  Because you:

1) Have a passionate interest in politics;

2) Enjoy discussing public policy matters; and

3) Maintain a keen interest in foreign affairs / international relations.

The NYC Political Forum is a nonpartisan, all-inclusive discussion group that welcomes all New Yorkers to gather and exchange their passionate views on public policy matters, notwithstanding one's political ideologies.

Our regular monthly meetup usually include a discussion of the following:

• Local news in NYC and the greater metropolitan area.

• Domestic politics and public policies of national significance.

• International relations and foreign affairs.

For our side events, we conduct in-depth discussions of the following: political philosophies and theories; historical subject matters; geopolitical case studies; the Constitution and court decisions; and other public policy matters.  To find out more about what we do, click here. 

While we welcome dissent and although we don't shy away from controversial, hot-button issues, we always strive for a respectful, civil discourse — therefore, we have a zero-tolerance policy for personal, ad hominem attacks, or demagoguery.

If all of the above fits your interests, you've definitely come to the right place!
results.name: "The NYC Political Forum"

results.description:
(New to voiceover, or looking to break into the VO business? Please skip down to the IMPORTANT NOTE below first!)

It's here: the first-ever Meetup group created by and devoted exclusively to working professional voice talent in New York City!

Unlike other VO groups focused on education, training, workouts, etc., our aim is to network working, credentialed voiceover professionals who live and work in the New York City metro by meeting face-to-face and discuss  daily work experiences, biz trends, and whatever else might aid our business, artistic, and personal growth. We'll experiment with a number of member-driven approaches to keep things fresh, informative, and useful for everyone.

While many of us have strong opinions on the issue, we strive to be non-partisan and open, and welcome working and experienced VO artisans from both the union and non-union sectors.

Admission will be limited, to assess the experience, proficiency levels, and skill sets of prospective members to help develop a framework that meets everyone's needs.


IMPORTANT NOTE:

This group was created by and for EXPERIENCED voice talent only. We're NOT another "get rich by breaking into the VO biz" outlet, educational school, or training resource.

This means all of us have committed to make VO our primary source of income, or it's a real, significant and very regular part of it.

In other words, we've paid our dues by doing this for a long time, and do it for a living every single day. Not part-time, not as a hobby, not as a source of quick "money on the side" with several months in between doing something else. It's our full-time job, or truly augments it (for example, some talented individuals do equal amounts of stage/film/TV as well as VO work ). If this sounds like you, we welcome seeing your application!

If you're "new to the biz", or "just looking to get into voiceover/voice acting", or simply want to "kick the tires" or "try things out" to learn more about the trade and see if it's right for you - unfortunately this group isn't designed for you. Please be advised if you apply, your request for membership will likely be rejected, and your/our time will have been wasted.

Please don't take this personally. Rejection is a daily reality in our business. Pros shrug it off and use it to drive themselves further ahead. There's a lot that goes into this profession, and it's not for everyone!

However, if you're still serious about doing this for a living in the future, there are plenty of outlets here on Meetup.com and elsewhere online that we highly encourage you to look into. Good luck in your search, and when you get more experience under your belt, we look forward to hearing from you in the future.
results.name: NYC Voiceover Meetup Group

results.description:
Jews For Fun stands for high quality entertainment, exceptional organization, upscale atmosphere, and exclusive events. 

Open for all Jews who are looking to have fun, good times, and meet others alike. Come join us for holiday celebrations, happy hours, NYC night life, outdoor activities, and more. 

You might wonder: "Why Jews?" and "Why For Fun?" "Every Jew is genetically predisposed towards great "success?" That's what you all think. We say: "NO. Every Jew is predisposed towards great joy, happiness, and fun!" In the long run of our history of persecution, destruction and anti-Semitism, we have forgotten how to party without pulling the safety break. Now the time has come to press on the pedal and shake it "like a polaroid picture." :)

 When we get together we want you to feel complete comfort, relaxation, joy, and to have an opportunity to meet new, interesting people. As Jews we share a lot in common and connect well with each other. Let's celebrate our rich cultural heritage and share what our ancestors gave to us: great sense of humor and infinite capacity to appreciate life. 

Jews For Fun, a 501(c)3 non-for-profit organization, was founded in 2009 in San Francisco. Having created over 20 most legendary and memorable events all over San Francsico Bay Area and LA, JFF has become the premier Jewish community and social network for young Jewish adults. 

We are excited to launch in NY and bring you high quality fun and entertainment JFF style. Please check out our Youtube channel at https://www.youtube.com/user/JemmEntertainment

Embracing change is hard for each and every one of us. No one is immune. Not the skinny size zero on the bus or the fabulously fit trainer in the gym. But the key to living our best life is to always keep trying. If we are open, we can find inspiration and support everywhere around us. This group is here to help members help themselves (and each other) move forward with the changes they choose to make in their lives.

This is your chance to explore new fitness, nutrition and behavior options - basically an opportunity to "try before you buy"! We will workout, eat and talk our way through the changes we all want to make.  And when times are tough, we will be there for each other. If you are fearless enough to be authentically you and have the courage to share your story with those around you, then this is the group for you!

So, get off the couch, push away from the desk or crawl out of bed.  This is a new year and today is an opportunity to begin your journey to a new you!

I hope to meet each and every one of you soon!

Your organizer and personal cheerleader,

Chandra


A brief note about your organizer: I am on my own weight loss and wellness journey and I created the Inspired Wellness Meetup Group so that I could build a mutually supportive community focused on helping each other reach our personal goals. I've spent the last several years learning about fitness, nutrition and behavior change so that I could help myself and others move their journeys forward. Over the last several years, I've become a licensed Zumba instructor, an ACE certified Group Fitness Instructor and a Mayo Clinic trained Wellness Coach. As a member of the American Personal & Private Chef Association, I've chosen to focus on teaching people how to prepare healthy food that tastes great. I look forward to sharing my journey with all of you. I hope you are as excited for the next the next phase of your life as I am about mine.

results.description:
This group has been around since 2002, but we're new-ish to Meetup, so we never really know who's going to show up . . . which makes it fun. We have a large email list, completely separate from this website, and get about 5 to 10 people per meeting just from that.

Anyway, most importantly, this group is commitment-free. Some of our members attend nearly every meeting; others show up once a month or even once a year. The main rule is to bring something to work on for the first hour. No assignments. No prompts. It's just a solid chunk of quiet time that you can use however you want.

After the writing, there's a short break, and then we gather a little closer to take turns introducing ourselves. After that, we spend another hour or so doing an informal reading of our work. No one is ever forced to read -- that's not our style -- so at any given meeting, about half the people might end up sharing something. Some people read stuff they've been working on for a while. Others read what they've written during the hour. There's no need to bring copies because we read aloud. Each person gets eight minutes, which includes time for others to offer feedback, so we keep things moving at a pretty good pace. 
People in this group have written and shared all kinds of stuff: novels, short stories, journal and diary entries, poems, personal essays, memoirs, plays, screenplays, articles, dialogues, outlines, limericks, newsletters, blogs, kids books, science fiction, erotica, comedy, book proposals, cartoon strips, horoscopes, wedding speeches, eulogies, and song lyrics. Anything goes, and the same is true for your writing experience. You don't have to be published or submit samples in order to join. The purpose is to have a varied crowd and a relaxed setting where we actually do some writing and have a chance to hang out and meet fellow writers, and since people often ask, we're mostly in our 20s and 30s.

We get together every week or two. There's no regular location because we usually meet in people's homes all over the place. (If you can host, please speak up!) Twice a year, we meet at a big, antiquarian bookstore in midtown. In warmer months, we meet semi-regularly in Central Park and other outdoor spots. We've even taken a few road trips as a group, but we almost always stay within MetroCard range. Once per month (ish), we meet on weekend afternoons, but we usually do our thing on weeknights from 7:00 until about 10:30pm. People are welcome to show up late or leave early, so don't worry if these times aren't ideal. Can't make it for the writing hour? No problem. Come after that and check out the readings.

We don't have a set schedule. Some people are never free on Mondays, for example, while others can never make it on weekends, so we meet on different days of the week to accommodate everyone.

Finally, this group has always been free (and will remain so for people who are already part of it), but because of the cost of advertising on Meetup, there's a suggested donation of $1 -- not per meeting, but just at the first one you attend.

That's it. Sorry for the long-ass description, but details are good, right?
results.name: NYC laid-back writing group

results.description:
PURPOSE:

Would you like to accurately learn and play the music of the Grateful Dead?  At each session, participants will learn two or three songs with song specific soloing strategies and extensive jamming.  Each session is two and a half hours.  Each session is limited to six participants.

The objective of these workshops is for individuals to express their developing concepts and performance skills in an organized context through the use of charts that demonstrate specific song forms, soloing strategies that are song specific, and learning techniques that utilize modern technology.  Additionally, the workshop will foster stronger group cohesion, rhythmic synchronization, and group groove. 

I have been coordinating a Grateful Dead Song and Jam group since 2010.  The same group of people have been getting together monthly to play and celebrate the music of the Grateful Dead.  These sessions are a lot of fun.  Now, through Meet Up.com, I'm looking to help more folks learn to play the music of the Grateful Dead with others.

WHO SHOULD JOIN:

This group is open to any and all instrumentalists and vocalists.  Drums, bass, keys and guitarists learn to interlock and groove.  Vocalists learn to place their melody into the wideness of the beat.  Attention to detail is spent on tempos, grooves, and dynamics.  Charts notate where in the beat the chords change.  Participants learn song specific soloing strategies to develop dramatically compelling solos.  Refinement of details transforms an ordinary song rendition into the highest level playing experience. 

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN:

The music of the Grateful Dead is a lot of fun to play solo and with others.  However, learning the music of the Grateful Dead can be problematic because there are many versions of any single song.    This is how I can help you learn.  This song and jam group is organized and structured so that participants actually learn the music the way the Grateful Dead played it.  The charts I use relate to specific studio and/or live performances and function as default arrangements.  I learned these parts from recordings and videos of band performances.  The charts are clear about song form, intros,  chord progressions, turnarounds, interludes and endings.  Both Jerry Garcia and Bob Weir’s parts will be taught. The charts demonstrate the correct rhythms, chord voicings, riffs and song form. In some cases, actual Phil Lesh bass lines have been transcribed.  The Grateful Dead, like many bands, shows that compositions may be flexible and improvisations may be structured.

Note to budding song writers and improvisers - understanding song form helps one to better develop a dramatic arc, memorize songs more easily and improves one’s ability to improvise and compose.

WHAT YOU CAN LEARN:

As we learn each song, participants will learn the correct chord progressions and song forms; the actual chord voicings Jerry used; the actual chord voicings Bob used; specific chord progressions used during the improv sections; pentatonic/blues boxes for soloing; chord/scale combinations; Jerry's use of chromaticism; complicated ostinatos; inversion of guitar roles; use of triads; alternating triads as an improvisational tool; modal scales as an improvisational tool; variations on tone production through the use of hybrid picking; and rhythm guitar adaptations of keyboard parts using two and three-note voicings with palm muting techniques. 

As the group coordinator, I will discuss how to build solos and the group will jam on those songs.  This is an opportunity to master your soloing skills.  However, there is no obligation to improvise.  There won’t be any pressure to do so.  People may simply strum along and enjoy that participation.

Although actual songs that the group covers is at the coordinator's discretion, group suggestions play a big part.  In previous sessions we have learned and jammed on over 50 songs including:  Alabama Getaway, Bertha, Big River, Birdsong, Black Muddy River, Brown Eyed Women, Casey Jones, China Cat Sunflower, Deal, El Paso, Eyes Of The World, Fire On The Mountain, Franklin's Tower, Friend Of The Devil, Goin' Down The Road Feeling Bad, Good Lovin’, I Know You Rider, Jack-A-Roe, Jackstraw, Johnny B. Goode, Little Red Rooster, Lovelight, Me and My Uncle, Might As Well, New Minglewood Blues, Peggy-O, Scarlet Begonias, Sugar Magnolia, Sugaree, Terrapin Station, Touch Of Grey, Truckin', Uncle John’s Band, US Blues.

ABOUT THE COORDINATOR:

I am a professional musician with over 40 years experience. I began playing the guitar at four years old and performing professionally at 15.  I've performed all over the world at countless venues and festivals.  Additionally, I teach privately and at a variety of music schools.  As a performer and recording artist I play many styles of music including rock, blues, jazz and folk.
results.name: New York City Grateful Dead Song and Jam Meetup

Members of HackNewYork are on the cutting edge of vulnerability research and regularly present at local information security group meetings (ISSA, OWASP) and international hacking conferences around the world (Defcon, HOPE, OWASP AppSec, Hacker Halted).

results.description:
Please join us at one of our local gatherings! Enjoy activities revolving around geek culture.

1. Our group is open to all levels of experience, from experts to dabblers and newbies.

2. We organize game and other events in a variety of formats each time. Come to the one you like and find some new favorites too!

We play modern (published in last 2 decades roughly) non-abstract strategy games.

We include gateway strategy games/euro games (e.g. Splendor, Ticket to Ride, 7 Wonders, Dominion, Settlers of Catan), lighter games (e.g. King of Tokyo, Love Letter), cooperation games (e.g. Pandemic, Forbidden Island, Hanabi) and medium to heavier games (e.g. Twilight Imperium, A Game Of Thrones). We sometimes mix social/party games with strategy (Coup, Resistance) to start, too. 

<br>

- If you have played only monopoly, risk, or clue, those are classic games and we do not play them but we can teach newer games (mostly published in 21st century). 

<br>

- We do not mean to exclude any games but the group is definitely more for strategy games not for party games (such as Card Against Humanity), and also not for abstract games or playing card games (we don't play chess, poker, or jenga).

3. We host our own events and join other relevant events hosted by other groups.

4. We work with other groups to foster an attitude of cooperation and collaboration. (Competitions and conflicts are only for games!)

5. We support local and independent artists, game developers, entrepreneurs in geek culture community. However, we are not an advertising platform for your product or business. Please do not use our group for sales or marketing.

6. We are open to suggestions. Board/card/video game, art, film, movie, novel, comic book, sci-fi, science, history, costume, lecture, discussion, convention, festival, and any other related event ideas are welcome.

7. Group is open to all ages, genders, personal statuses, as well as to all levels of interest. Most events are open to all; however, it is possible that some events, by nature, are intended for specific attendees (such as game tournament). While we cannot make every event for everyone, we try to organize a variety of events to provide a widely inclusive experience and opportunities for attendees to meet people with similar interests.

https://www.facebook.com/TheCityBoardCommunity

results.description:
Qui sommes-nous ? Nous sommes des Français, natifs d'un pays francophone ou des passionnés qui parlent très bien le français. Nous voulons organiser des Meetups autour de l'art et la culture (française ou non) et passer un bon moment. Les personnes faisant partie de ce groupe parlent couramment le français. 

Qui ne sommes-nous pas ? Nous ne sommes pas un groupe qui cherche à apprendre le français, il y a beaucoup d'autres meetups qui offrent des possibilités pour des cours de conversation et à différents niveaux. Nos membres parlent couramment le français, même si le français n'est pas leur langue maternelle. 
Nous ne sommes pas non plus un groupe organisant des fêtes. Les évènements proposés auront toujours un caractère culturel : exposition ou galerie, visite en français, découverte de traditions culinaires françaises. 

Comment s'inscrire ? Vous avez juste besoin d'appuyer sur le bouton lien Join Us / Rejoindre sur notre page Meetup. Répondez ensuite entièrement aux questions. Les questions sont un moyen de reconnaître qui parle vraiment le français. Il est important de répondre complètement aux questions. Ensuite, nous recevrons votre demande et votre email pour une acceptation. Nous ne pouvons pas accepter les demandes qui ne reflètent pas les objectifs du groupe. 

Quel type d'évènements proposez-vous ? Est-ce gratuit ? Faire partie du groupe est complement gratuit, la seule chose que nous demandons c'est d'être respectueux de nos soirées et de réserver à l'avance pour nous permettre des nous organiser correctement. Certaines rencontres nécessitent une participation financière normale. Nous essayons de proposer des évènements abordables : sorties dans un lieu lié à la culture française, une exposition d'un/d'une artiste française, une visite en français... Les évènements sont limités à 15 personnes pour des questions d'organisation et pour refléter l'objectif du groupe.

Merci d'avance et a bientôt !
results.name: Art et culture en français à New York

With a special diaphragm target-training exercise you will be freeing body, strengthening breath support, calming you and clarifying voice you will be using your new capacity in group and individual exercises for instant integration of emotion and your creative mind. You will become a more resourceful presenter/performer, with exercises that are easy to understand and practice, effectively raising the bar on your ability. This meetup will always feel safe, be dynamic and a fun place to learn and grow. 
Benefits include: 
Public Speaking: More confidence and energy and a clearer mind to reach your audience with impact.
Nerves and Confidence: more oxygen to your brain means you will be calmer and think more clearly.
Legit Stage:  a stronger diaphragm means more easy projection, more energy and emotional dynamics in your voice whether speaking or singing.
Film and TV: having more mental energy gives you more authentic expression and better/faster interpretation of direction.
Auditions: being more energized and focused means you will prepare sides faster and better.
Casting Agent Interviews:  being more relaxed and connected to your feelings and passion comes across as confidence.

results.description: Staten Island Arts Folklife program is dedicated to the preservation,promotion, and safeguarding of traditional arts, through programming and technical assistance. These art forms are the fabric of cultural heritage and represent an important grassroots dimension of the cultural sector. On Staten Island, examples of these expressions can be found in the architecture of Our Lady of Mount Carmel Grotto, the performance of Liberian folktales being told in their native dialects, the distribution of Sri Lankan foodways through markets and restaurants, the ritual and celebration of Mexican Independence Day, and the occupational traditions that preserve one of the city’s last working waterfront. This Meetup group will be used to share traditional arts initiatives throughout Staten Island and beyond. It will also serve as a space to share knowledge and resources for making the traditional arts stronger on Staten Island. If you have any questions, please e-mail our regional and county folklorist, Christopher J. Mulé at cmule@statenislandarts.org or call (718) 447-3329 ext. 1006.
results.name: Staten Island Arts Folklife

results.description:
ALL DETAILS HERE, also this is where you should submit your music/performance proposals for consideration.

What had started as a series of house concerts now becomes an opportunity for young musicians and composers to present their efforts to the public. 

Curated by NY-based conductor/composer Peter Breiner and based on the same concept as his house concerts, this series will be the result of the many encounters Breiner has had with local musicians, both professionally and personally. 

You would be hard-pressed to find greater evidence of NYC being a melting pot and a cultural/musical Mecca of the world. So far these concerts, consisting of a random collection of musicians, have always presented an incredibly high level of musicianship and artistry. The connections made at these events have serendipitously led to further collaborations and opportunities. 

Starting in January 2014, a beautiful space at Bohemian National Hall will be filled with music that is both contemporary and looking toward the future, trying to incorporate all the latest developments in technology while at the same time firmly rooted in musical traditions and connected to Czech musical culture. As an example, one of the concerts will present a Piano Trio by Bedrich Smetana and also a Cello Sonata by 22-year-old composer Kristina Smetana. 

Connections like this one will be at the heart of the dramaturgy of the series while at the same time putting out a call for new pieces and musicians and try to fit them into the random flow of events called life. Concerts of the series will take place (with a few exceptions) on the last Friday of each month for as long as the serendipity continues to work. 

As a part of the evening, we will also have talks and discussions—perhaps even panels—about the future of classical music, with some prominent and very interesting speakers. 

We are not setting any age limits, but we want to gear the series towards young composers and musicians (young at heart could also qualify).
results.name: New York's Sounds of Serendipity

results.description:
Crowdfunding is an industry that many Americans know little about.  Let's begin with what Crowdfunding is exactly:


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rTRqaAlZ2Hs

Reality Crowd TV is a grassroots movement that is not only occurring in the United States, but all around the globe.  We are creating a Reality TV Show around the Crowdfunding Movement that will be Crowdfunded.

What is our Mission?

To Inform, Educate, Inspire, and Motivate Entrepreneurs Worldwide to Start Small Businesses through Crowdfunding, and Provide the Blueprint on How to Crowdfund.

What is the Purpose of this Meetup?

We will be hosting events across the country as part of our Nationwide Tour to Inform America, and subsequently the globe, about Reality Crowd TV's mission and about Crowdfunding in general:

American Tour Press Release

World Tour Press Release

Who is behind this Meetup Group?

Manolis Sfinarolakis is the Founder & Creator of Reality Crowd TV.

Jessica Sun is the CEO of Reality Crowd TV.

What's in it for you?  Why should you join?

We aim to use this meetup group to accomplish two goals:

• To assist us in organizing our nationwide and worldwide tour schedule

• To inform, educate, inspire, and motivate entrepreneurs worldwide to start small businesses through Crowdfunding and provide them a blueprint on how to Crowdfund.

We will provide our members with PRACTICAL, not THEORETICAL advice on how to Crowdfund as we ourselves have prepared for three months to launch our own Crowdfunding campaign.  

We by no means consider ourselves experts but we do have lessons learned that we would love to share with our members in a non-judgement free environment.  Too many people are making themselves out to be experts without ever having the experience of Crowdfunding under their belt.  

Our meetup group seeks to provide you with actionable knowledge and information from day 1.  We check the theory at the door and focus on what will make you successful in your own endeavors.  We hope we are making this abundantly clear, we want people to join us who GET THINGS DONE! 

Our Channels of Communication

http://www.realitycrowdtv.com

http://www.facebook.com/realitycrowdtv

http://www.twitter.com/realitycrowdtv

http://www.youtube.com/realitycrowdtv

http://www.pinterest.com/realitycrowdtv

http://www.instagram.com/realitycrowdtv

https://plus.google.com/+Realitycrowdtv
results.name: Virtual Crowdfunding Meetup by Reality Crowd TV

Our club is in its second year and is slowly, but steadily growing. We couldn't be happier with the membership we've attracted -- there's been so much great food and great conversation shared by an interesting, friendly, and diverse group of people who we honestly can't even imagine never having met. 

One important note: We are all about participation. We'd rather be a small group of people who participate, than have hundreds of members who don't. So be prepared to join in if you join; otherwise, what's the point, right?

We hope to meet you soon!

Cheers,

Donna


Note: We generally hold the reservations to a maximum of 14 people (or seven couples) for each meetup, just to make it manageable for the restaurant, so if you see a meetup posted that you want to attend, please RSVP early to ensure a seat at the table :)

results.description:
Has anyone ever told you…“Why do you have to be SO weird? Why can’t you just be like the rest of us?”

Every single day, you are being hunted by high expectations of normalcy, stereotypes, and the pressure to fit in.
If you don’t conform, then you are criticized, rejected, and made to feel like something is wrong with you.

Black and white.
Right and wrong.
You either fit in or you are an outcast.

So, in order to survive, you hide certain parts.
Presenting only the pre-packaged version that is acceptable.

Even if this version is 99% truth, you keep the scariest, most vulnerable parts locked away where no one can find them.

Thing is… what if the very parts you hide are the best parts of you?
What if those parts are what makes you extraordinary? The indefinable “something” only you have.
What if sharing them, and connecting with people around them, was the true unlock key for joy and love and true acceptance and success in life?

What if people “got” you? No explanation needed?

Living Quirky is a way of being.
A lifelong commitment to courage.

Living Quirky is for those who can no longer pretend to live in black and white when there is a full-color, high-definition, more alive, more vibrant, more meaningful, and more connected way of being!

We dive into the depths of who you truly are and then rise together as a QuirkNation to honor and celebrate what makes each of us different.

We are the crazy ones going against the grain, doing what other people are too scared to do.
We do it because we have to.
It’s just who we are.

We challenge assumptions, stepping outside of our comfort zone because we are in search of the soulful, courageous, vulnerable, essential truth within each of us.

Living Quirky is when you live 100% all in, letting your quirk out, and revealing how powerful you already are.

I cannot do this without you.
Only if we come together, can there be a QuirkNation.
Together, we can shake up the status quo with our own very sweet twist of life!

It’s time to raise your quirk-flag and declare YOUR Quirkpower!

Join the Quirk Invasion at: http://livingquirky.com/
results.name: Living Quirky in NYC

Scala Bug Bash is a programming meetup that helps the Scala open-source community by coordinating the efforts of software developers in and around NYC.

This meetup is for software engineers (no recruiters :) who want to give back to the Scala community by contributing patches to open-source projects. We all stand on the shoulders of giants; existing projects like unfiltered and kafka and scalding, to name just a few, allow us to build {more,better,faster} systems. Helping open source helps all of us. It's also a great way to meet other like-minded people and to improve as a developer.

At the meetup itself, we work together to help these projects by fixing bugs, adding documentation, and adding features. So bring a laptop and come ready to write some code!

results.description:
This free Meetup is being formed to acquaint you to one of Long Island's oldest outdoor organizations: The Nassau Hiking and Outdoor Club or NHOC. (NHOC) is an organization of over 400 members from every walk of life, who share a common appreciation of the outdoors. There's something for everyone at NHOC. Aside from hiking, the club is involved with many activities including camping, walking, horseback riding, bicycling, picnicking, and just about anything which broadens knowledge of and respect for nature. Some members participate in trail maintenance and other conservation efforts. During the winter months, indoor as well as outdoor activities are offered. All hikes and activities are graded on their level of difficulty - from easy ("C") to challenging ("A"). We are a friendly, social group looking for new members.  Many of our members fall into the SINGLES category and there is no better way to find new friends than by participating in an activity that you love. If you decide to become a full paying member of NHOC, you will receive our Shorelines publication several times throughout the year, informing you of all of our activities. We organize 15-30 hikes per month throughout the New York area. Parties, social gatherings, city walks, movie nights, bowling, and weekend trips are only some of the wide range of activities that we plan for our members. Annual dues is only $30 (Individual) or $40 (Family). 

As a Meetup member, you may join us for 2 hikes before becoming a full paying member of NHOC.

Here is link to our membership form: 

  http://www.nassauhiking.org/NHOCMembership_form_2014.pdf

For more information, here is a link to our website:

http://www.nassauhiking.org
results.name: Nassau Hiking and Outdoor Club (NHOC)

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in learning Italian having fun, kind of an HAPPY HOUR where you 'drink' a rich and beautiful culture with an experienced native Tutor. 

All skills levels are welcome since there will be 3 groups: Beginners- Intermediate- Advanced (book clubs) When possible or requested, we'll go to museums and Italian institutes for exhibitions and events. I start this group to combine language and culture (with readings, speaking, conversations, games) and planning trips to inland Italy, a non-conventional Tourism. 

Each member will become an expert, really close to become a real Italian. Looking forward to exploring il BEL PAESE with real passion, going in depth, teaching the tricks to learn fast, tailoring gatherings and classes on your personal interests (arts, archaeology, history, cinema, opera, literature etc.).” You will love this new adventure!! 

Where? Midtown Manhattan. Also in Queens, near Sunnyside or Queensboro Plaza, upon request only.


   SCHEDULE: Every day. If you don't see a class on the calendar, ask for a lesson or make a suggestion to involve more people

- NEW! For private lessons one-on-one (1 hour and 15 minutes): contact me ;-)

I provide with copies each time, I come with an Agenda, but feel free to bring any book of your interest

For the Advanced ones: we will also decide together what Italian book we will read loud and go in depth (both the text work and the social-economical and political context):  DANTE, MACHIAVELLI, MANZONI, LEOPARDI, MORAVIA, ORIANA FALLACI, SAVIANO etc.

Do you have a favorite one? Aren't you curious to see how the PRINCE of Machiavelli is so modern nowadays? 

What about Mrs. Fallaci and her predictions on Islam in Europe? Where she was right and where wrong? How will you describe her style? How will you feel after reading her?

And what about a pessimist like LEOPARDI living in an always-positive country like ITALY? Why is he becoming more popular and translated worldwide?

Also.....have you ever dreamed of going to ITALY and visiting a magic place which is inland, rich of culture and tradition and beauty...with a well-educated native that knows your interests and hobbies?? With Authentic Italy your Private Tutor is also your Travel Planner and your adventure pal!! Are you ready for this amazing journey?? I am ;-)

Get involved, start this journey, it might change your life's philosophy and approach. There's a bit of Italy in each of us ;-)

Grazie e a presto. 

Valentina
results.name: AUTHENTIC ITALY=with a NATIVE. Language& cultural Tours!!

results.description: The Classical Musicians' Rehearsal Symphony Orchestra, LLC, is a membership symphony composed of professional-level musicians who play just for the love of it.  A rehearsal symphony, sometimes called a "reading" orchestra, is a musical organization whose focus is on playing simply for the love of it, pursuing performance-level achievement, absent the administrative and financial pressures associated with public concert performance.  Auditions are not required.  All accomplished instrumentalists — professional and amateur, irrespective of age, experience, or walk of life — who share a love of classical music and the desire to make music with like-minded musicians are welcome to belong.  Rehearsals are held at various times and locations in Manhattan, NYC, as posted at www.rehearsalsymphony.com.  Also posted is a schedule of classics we will be playing.  Seating is not competitive; firsts and seconds reverse positions at each rehearsal of each work.  We are not concerned with imbalances in membership or attendance; e.g., many flutists, few violists.  We play, just for the love of it!  RSVP is requested so we can provide parts in advance of each rehearsal.
results.name: The Classical Musicians' Rehearsal Symphony Orchestra, LLC

results.description:
Hola a todos!

Purpose of our group: This group is for people who want to improve their Spanish or English.

What members should expect from the group: Organizers of this group will make sure that members are learning in a non-intimidating atmosphere and most importantly, that everyone has fun while learning. This group is meant to be fun and social but we really like to stress the importance of practicing English and Spanish.

What organizers expect from the members: As this is not an instruction-based group, members need to be at least at an intermediate level. Members are expected to fully participate and converse in English and Spanish. Please be considerate and practice both languages.

Additional: We keep this group small for a reason. We believe that in smaller groups, each individual learner has more of a chance to speak up. Especially for those who are shy. We also believe that members benefit the most in smaller groups and have the opportunity to talk to each and every member.
results.name: Queens Spanish & English Conversation Exchange

results.description:
This is a Fantastic Social Group for Men & Women, in their 40's & 50's, to form new friendships in and have fun!  Let's meet each other, share our passions, and create great times together.  I'd like to meet new friends who are available, adventurous, reliable and kind.  Do you want the same?  Are you looking to form solid friendships & experience fun times with people in your own age group? 

NO-SHOWS:  AFTER TWO, you'll be removed from the group.  Please keep your RSVP'S UPDATED and Cancel up to ONE DAY PRIOR, if you need to.  If you Cancel at the last min which prevents someone else from going, it'll be considered a 'no show' (except in an emergency.)         

My cell # is always listed on my posts--Please call/text if you are going to be late instead of posting a message on the Meetup site (which I won't see.)  You have chosen a 'Great, Friendly & Fun Group!'  :-) 

**You MUST HAVE YOUR OWN TRANSPORTATION!  That means NO Reaching Out to Group Members & No Postings asking for Rides!  I am very firm about this.  Thank You for your understanding.  Of course, if there's an event that is a distance away, we can carpool.     

This meetup began centered around 'Hicksville' for most events, but now has branched out mainly to anywhere in Nassau with some events held in Suffolk, and NYC occasionally.  If you have attended at least three meetups and are interested in becoming an EVENT HOST please let me know.  I try to offer a variety of fun activities with friendly people!  I am also open to any new suggestions that you may have for the group.  Thank you, see you at an upcoming event, soon!

results.description:
About Us

3WCircle provides a platform for women to redefine success, happiness and connection.

Our members are entrepreneurs, stay at home moms, thinkers and innovators.  Despite our unique backgrounds, our desire to be introspective and honest is what ties our circle together.

Through our events, expert-led discussions and online articles, members can grow, evolve and be inspired by exposure to different perspectives.  Authentic connections, real conversations and moments of self-actualization are part of the 3W experience.

All women who are introspective can engage in the conversation whether they are forming a new business or starting a family. Moms, CEO’s, innovators, and entrepreneurs come together to talk as women not as professionals.

Membership

Our events are for members only.  Members are admitted after completing an application.  You will be prompted to answer our 3 question application when you join our Meetup Group.  

Our membership criteria include authenticity, openness and a willingness to connect with others.
results.name: 3WCircle

results.description:
Join us… a patient-driven support community for people suffering from Hashimoto's Thyroiditis. We, the Hashimoto's Awareness Organization raise awareness of the disease connecting people to proper testing for early diagnosis. We believe Hashimoto's Thyroiditis is reversible through a holistic approach to treatment. We are a source of education, advocacy, and directly connected to the latest research nationwide to inspire and enable people to live a symptom free life. 


We meet once a month and invite key note speakers/experts in the field on healing Hashimoto's disease. At the meetup you will:

 *Learn from other people’s successful experiences 

 *Discover treatment approaches and information you may not know about

 *Be empowered by asking for and receiving support

 *Share your personal story 

 *Develop a sense of community. 


You are not alone. Whether you have been dealing with this disorder for many years or have been recently diagnosed, join us for an evening of great conversation and support. Together we will create the possibility of making a life changing difference for you and others. We will meet twice a month, create a network via Internet if desired, and in the future, provide opportunity and training for those interested in creating similar support groups in other areas or cities. 

Fabienne Heymans, Pearl Thomas & Joseph Campos and our wonderful Board of Advisors.
results.name: Hashimoto's Awareness

results.description: The Samaritans of New York, a non-religious, non-profit organization in New York City offers free bereavement support groups for individuals who have lost a loved one to suicide who seek a safe and supportive environment where they can talk about their thoughts and feelings and share their experiences tied to their loss in the company of other people who have had similar experiences. The meetings are free and offered twice a month on weekday evenings at convenient Manhattan locations. The meetings are only open to those who have lost a loved one to suicide and participants must be at least 18 years of age to attend. If you are interested in attending a support group meeting, please visit http://samaritansnyc.org/coping-with-suicide-loss/ to learn more about the meetings, meeting dates and locations. Alternatively, you can call Samaritans Safe Place program at (212) 673-3041 to receive further information about meetings, dates and sites. In your voicemail message, please leave your full contact information and the best time to reach you and someone from the program will get in touch with you.
results.name: Support Group for Survivors of Suicide Loss

results.description:
This group is for women ages 25-45 who live around the downtown Brooklyn (Carroll Gardens-Borum Hill-Cobble Hill-Brooklyn Heights-Park Slope) area. It's a book club first and foremost but also a place to meet other women, create friendships and have a glass (or four) of wine. Books we read can be suggested by the group and cover a range of topics. Please come to this group with a sense of humor and don't take it too seriously. Lets casually discuss our book, get a little tipsy and make lasting friendships in the area.

Because my goal is to create real friendships and a group that gets together regularly, please RSVP for all events-- even if you can't attend. If the days I choose don't work for you-- I want to know! I'll be limiting the number of women who join so that we can be a successful group. It should also be said that participation is expected. Members who don't attend a meetup within 6 months, regularly no show or RSVP will be removed. That is just to keep a small active group of women who know one another and have great conversation. My email is always available if anyone has ideas, suggestions or issues. I love hearing from you!!

results.description:
TAD (Telecom Application Developer) Meetup and TADHack (TAD Hackathon) NY/NJ is for all developers and engineers who are interested in helping to evolve communications technologies and practices. Telecom application developers include: telco independent software vendors, system integrators, enterprise developers and many other developers building apps that live either in the core telecom network, enterprise data centers or public cloud. Check out TADHack.com.

Whether you have expertise in development, telecom engineering, mobile technologies, or business, if you share our passion for innovation and disruption come join us at a local TAD Meetup and help facilitate new emerging markets for IP-enabled communications applications.

Some of the technologies discussed include:
Telecom APIs (including any IP based communication services; video communications; rich communications services; the good old PSTN; etc.)
WebRTC (Web Real Time Communications)
CRBT (Call Ring Back Tone) APIs
In-Call services, that is new services within the call made possible through IMS (IP Multimedia Subsystem)
SMS/USSD applications for developing markets and e-inclusion such as mobile payments, banking, e-commerce, bitcoin for emerging markets, etc.
Converged applications, e.g. taking the idea of Amazon Mayday, and embedding customer experience management everywhere
In-network services, including NFV (Network Function Virtualization) and SDN (Software Defined Networks)
Business vertical focused applications in healthcare, automotive, government, entertainment, financial, customer care, etc.
Internet of things, high speed fiber-based services, mash-ups across themes, really anywhere you think telecoms can make life better.
results.name: TADMeetup and TADHack NY/NJ

results.description:
Hi Everyone,


This Meetup offers busy, active people the chance to experience the practices of yoga and meditation in a comfortable, supportive and safe environment designed to help build awareness, concentration and enhance well-being.

Group is taught by me, Joan Stenzler, an experienced Kripalu Yoga teacher in Fresh Meadows. I offer Gentle Yoga classes, Meditation groups and Wellness-oriented experiential workshops and programs. I hope that you will come and try one my programs for yourself and bring a friend along!

Please know that while I do offer some groups at no charge, most of these sessions are designed to introduce students to my 8-Week Yoga Classes and upcoming Wellness Workshops and Classes.

So while some yoga classes will be FR*EE, once you come and see if you like it , you would then need to decide if you wanted to join my Yoga class series for which there is a charge. (The same is true to my Meditation & Wellness Workshops.)

I offer a discount of $20 off to my Meetup members who decide to register for my Yoga Series after a  FR*EE session, as a way to support your participation and still cover my costs.

It is simply impossible for me to hold this group without charging and still cover my expenses.

PLEASE KNOW THAT THE PURPOSE OF THIS GROUP IS TO GAIN KNOWLEDGE AND EXPAND IT THROUGH DEDICATED PRACTICE AND CONVERSATION.

This is not a group to join if you are looking meet people in order to pursue romantic encounters.

Please respect this guideline if you do decide to come to enable all group members can have a safe and comfortable experience! Thank you for your understanding.

I look forward to meeting some of you in class soon!

Joan Stenzler
Professional Level Kripalu Yoga Teacher
results.name: Gentle Yoga and Meditation in Fresh Meadows

We need a fair number of skilled acoustic musicians - guitar, banjo, mandolin, etc. The music: traditional and 60s/70s folk with some old country thrown in. A bit of bluegrass and modern folk too. Coffe and tea served. Snacks volunteered. Music provided and projected on the wall to follow along. Music additions and volunteers welcome. This is not for new singer songwriters or old rock/pop. results.description:
Finally, a supportive and safe place to learn about BPD... This year, for the first time, TARA has convened Get the Facts about BPD: Support and Psychoeducation group for people coping with BPD. These courageous people are sharing the shame and sense of failure that dominates their every day as they live from crisis to crisis. TARA's group has enabled these people, living in loneliness and pain to come together in safety, share their stories and find strength in a common bond of shared suffering and understanding. 

If you have been diagnosed with BPD or are exploring the possibility that you might have the disorder, join us for learning, support and conversation. This peer-focused group is practical and solution-oriented. It is neither group therapy nor a support group nor is it a substitute for treatment. 

We at TARA admire those who take the brave step into evidence-based treatment for BPD, despite countless failures and begin to find relief. Their stories are showing us how profound the isolation and pain of living with BPD is and how much more we all need to do to help them live their lives with less pain. Learn more about our work at www.tara4bpd.org
results.name: NYC Get the Facts about BPD: Support & Education TARA Meetup

results.description: The Oscar® and Emmy® Award-winning Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers® (SMPTE®), a professional membership association, is the worldwide leader in developing and providing motion-imaging standards and education for the communications, technology, media, and entertainment industries. An internationally recognized and accredited organization, SMPTE advances moving-imagery education and engineering across the broadband, broadcast, cinema, and IT disciplines. Since its founding in 1916, SMPTE has published the SMPTE Motion Imaging Journal and developed more than 650 standards, recommended practices, and engineering guidelines. More than 6,000 members — motion-imaging executives, engineers, creative and technology professionals, researchers, scientists, educators, and students— who meet in Sections throughout the world, sustain the Society. Sections are the face of SMPTE to many of our members – a great resource for educational programming, technical expertise, and networking . Currently, SMPTE has 27 local sections worldwide, which host more than 200 meetings, tutorials and workshops each year. The New York Section elects officers that plan local technical programs, tailoring the programming to the interests of the NY audience and our available resources.
results.name: SMPTE ® New York Section

results.description:
What is Couchbase?

Couchbase is the company behind Couchbase open source project, a vibrant community of developers and users of Couchbase document-oriented database technology. 

Couchbase Server is a packaged version of Couchbase technology that’s available in Community and Enterprise Editions. Couchbase is known for easy scalability, consistent high performance, 24x365 availability, and a flexible data model. 

Companies like AOL, Cisco, Concur, LinkedIn, Orbitz, Salesforce.com, Shuffle Master, Zynga and hundreds of others around the world use Couchbase Server for their interactive web and mobile applications.


Sign up to our Couchase Developer newsletter

results.description:
About Wearable Wednesday NY

Wearable Wednesday NY was founded by Paul Farkas to explore, recognize, and highlight key brands and thoughleaders in Wearable Tech. 

In association with Wearable World Inc. Wearable Wednesday events are an open community forum focused on the blending of technology, art and humanity in the Wearable Technology and Internet of Things ecosystem.  Our goal is to provide a platform for industry innovators, entrepreneurs, builders and investors to connect with like-minded, motivated people with the knowledge, vision and partnerships that will move the Internet of Wearable Things ecosystem forward. Group Meetups will include both technical and market-oriented sessions. Wearable Wednesdays are held globally across the world’s top tech centers, including San Francisco, New York, Dallas and London, and we continue to launch new locations periodically. Meet the most innovative wearable tech entrepreneurs in your community, demo products, share ideas and discuss trends in both local and global markets. http://wearableworld.co/
results.name: Wearable Wednesday NYC
