results.description:
This group is for Artists/Musicians/Writers/Photographers and other types of creatives, who are residents of the Bronx and are interested in meeting other like minded artistic enthused people.

A lot of people say that the Art scene is severely lacking, in comparison to the other boroughs is that true? Or is the truth that many artists live in the Bronx, but are forced to travel to Manhattan, Brooklyn & Queens, because they themselves believe that there is no "art scene" in their home town. What if we decided to stop traveling? What if we decided to settle our roots and show people what the Bronx Art scene is really about? 

Let's use this group to collaborate, and grow together and show the public what the Bronx Art Scene could progress to be if people gave it a chance to grow and flourish the same way that the other boroughs have.

results.description:
The best part of the StartupBus phenomenon is the awesome community that it has created. This meetup is here to make it easy for the New York community to hold events, to stay connected, and to continue fostering entrepreneurship in our region!

---

Founded in 2010, StartupBus is building a global entrepreneurial ecosystem through unique experiences and inspirational connections. We are a community run organization, primarily staffed with unpaid volunteers; our underlying vision with all activities is to empower the people that create change in the world and disrupt the status quo, in order to create a better life for all. Our worldwide members routinely participate in and organize events of all kinds in order to further cultivate entrepreneurship and innovation in their local regions.

StartupBus also produces the most intense startup competition in the world, where top talent from across the planet compete as 'Buspreneurs' to build the next generation of startup companies over the course of a multi-day road trip. Our 1,000+ member global network runs these competitions on nearly every continent.

http://startupbus.com/

Please read our About page to see our guidelines for membership in this Meetup.

OUR MISSION: 40’z Rock is a movement designed to encourage all women in their 40’z to embrace and celebrate their age, health, life and community.

ABOUT 40'z ROCK NEW JERSEY: As an extension of the 40’z ROCK national brand founded by Sandra Wyckoff out of Houston, TX, the 40'z Rock New Jersey Chapter seeks to identify and welcome all women ages 40-49 of all ethnicities to attend our functions which will be held across the state, including Rockland and Westchester counties of New York State.

Get into your body in a whole new way with Nia®, a sensory-based movement practice that leads to health, wellness and fitness.  It empowers people of all shapes and sizes by connecting the body, mind, emotions and spirit through a mindful blend of the dance, healing and martial arts including T'ai Chi, Tae Kwon Do, Aikido, jazz dance, modern dance, Duncan dance, yoga, Alexander Technique and the teachings of Moshe Feldenkrais.  Classes are taken in bare feet to soul-stirring music.  Prior knowledge of dance and the martial arts is not required.  Men and women of all ages are welcomed to experience your bodies like you never have before!  Become transformed by Nia®!

To find out more about Nia®, check out our national website at www.nianow.com or watch a promotional video

results.description:
The English Language Instruction Meetup:

This is an English Language Instruction group for Asians who are learning or mastering the English language.


The groups members come from many East Asian nations (China, Japan, and Korea especially). We welcome members from other countries also.  There are many members from countries such as India, Mongolia, Thailand, etc..   There are also many Columbia and NYU students, and Asians who are doing Internships in America.  The members stay in Brooklyn, Manhattan, New Jersey, and Queens.  This group offers these English Learners a way to learn English in a fun, social environment, that is outside of their normal school and/or workplace.

This is an opportunity for everyone who is Asian and has not mastered the English language to practice the art of conversation and speaking English in groups.   This group allows you to meet, socialize, and build English speaking skills, listening skills, and confidence with the English language.  This is all accomplished in an environment with like minded Asian English learners.

This is an excellent group if you want to:  Learn English - Find Asian Friends in New York - Learn American Culture - Spend the Holidays with Other Visiting Asians - Go to Karaoke - Learn to sing Karaoke in English!

Join us and meet fellow Asian English learners.  We have formal and informal introductions, and everybody gets a chance to talk.  The conversations are fun, relaxed, and are organized by a native English speaker who makes sure everybody is talking and learning English conversation skills.

This is a meetup for Asians in and near Manhattan that want to learn and work on their English language skills!

OUR REGULAR EVENTS ARE:

• English Conversation Practice for Asians (FREE!). - 3rd Saturday of every month.

• English Conversation Practice for Asians Intensive ($10). - 1st, 2nd, and 4th Saturday of every month.

• English Conversation parties and holidays (FREE!).  - The holiday events are scheduled as holidays appear on the calendar.  We have events for American and Asian holidays.

• Art Galleries (FREE!)

• Music Concerts (Cost Varies)

• Dance Parties (FREE!)

• Karaoke Events ($6-$15 an hour)

• Restaurant Socials

• TOEFL Tutoring

• Museum Trips to the Museum of Natural History and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. ($1.00 Museum entry cost). - We go to the museum about once every 3 months.

• Annual Ski and Snowboard Trip ($150-$300)

• English Conversation and Vocabulary Intensive for Bankers, Economist, and Financial workers.  ($25) - This event is once a month.

If you are interested in an event, but do not see it listed on our calendar, send me an message.


/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/



Below are descriptions of a few of our English Language Events:

_______________________________________________________________________________________________
ENGLISH CONVERSATION FOR ASIANS PRACTICE  - (THIS EVENT IS FREE!) 

Lessons:  We practice English greetings, introductory conversations, social chit chat, and describing and identifying ourselves.  We have informal and formal conversations.  We talk for an 1 hour and 15 minutes, take a rest, and then talk again.  We have plenty of networking time, and it is easy to make new friends.  After the meetup, some of us usually get lunch. 

The group has a large number of Asians (Female and Male) from; China, Japan, and Korea, who arrived in America less than a month before coming to the meetup.  They are eager to meet other Asians who are new to the New York area in order to find new friends.  We teach them basic conversation and networking skills and we show them how to strengthen their core English conversation abilities.

NO ENGLISH CONVERSATION EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Price: This event is FREE!

Time: 12 noon - 3pm  (If you can't make it at 12, you can drop in at anytime.)

Date: The third Saturday of every month.

The Instructor:  Erik, the instructor is a Buddhist/Taoist, native English speaker, who engages the learners in fun and educational conversations.   

Place: To be announced the first Saturday of every month.  We are usually going to meet midtown in Korea Town.

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  You can check our meetup page for the address and directions.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

ENGLISH CONVERSATION INTENSIVE

Lessons: We practice English greetings, conversations, social chit chat, and describing and identifying ourselves.  We have many formal and some informal conversations.  This is a 7 hour meetup.  We have plenty of networking time, and it is easy to make new friends.  This meetup is similar to our 3 hour meetup, only it is more intensive.  The group size is smaller and there is emphasis on the individual student and their specific needs and problems.  There is also more time for making friends.  We cover significantly more material than in our 3 hour group.  This is a meetup specially suited for people who want to learn English quickly or who find it is going to be important for them to strengthen their English speaking abilities.

NO ENGLISH CONVERSATION EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Price: This event is $10.00  We only have the intensive if 2 or more people register before the date of the Intensive.  We only allow 10 people to register for this event, so you should register early.

Time: 12 noon - 7pm  (If you can't make it at 12, you can drop in at anytime.)

Date: The first and fourth Saturday of every month.

The Instructor:  Erik, the instructor is a Buddhist/Taoist, native English speaker, who engages the learners in fun and educational conversations. 

Place: To be announced the first Saturday of every month.  We are usually going to meet around midtown on the West side, in Korea Town.

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  We send directions via email to all attending members.  You can also check our Meetup page for the address and directions.

____________________________________________________________________________________________

ENGLISH CONVERSATION, PARTY and KARAOKE!

The English Conversation Party and Karaoke Meetup! We have English conversations and then party!. The rule is the topics for the conversations at our Parties have to be fun.  Topics during the Holiday parties are always about the holiday that is occurring.  We do this event for Holidays and for every season (Winter, Spring, Summer, and Autumn).  Every Holiday Meetup includes a 15 minutes description of the Holiday, its customs, and how the Holiday is celebrated in America.   You are also taught American cultural customs during the Holiday event. 

THE PURPOSE OF THESE EVENTS IS TO GIVE ASIANS WHO ARE NOT AMERICAN, A SENSE OF COMMUNITY AND A CHANCE TO CELEBRATE DURING THE  YEAR AND DURING THE HOLIDAYS.  PLEASE BRING YOUR FRIENDS, ROOMMATES, AND ESL BUDDIES!

ENGLISH CONVERSATION PARTY AND KARAOKE MEETUPS:

• Thanksgiving Dinner

• Christmas Party!

• Memorial Day Celebration!

• July 4th Celebration!

• Winter English Conversation Instruction and Party!

• Spring English Conversation and Party!

• Summer English Conversation Instruction and Party!

• Autumn English Conversation Instruction and Party!

NO ENGLISH CONVERSATION EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Price: These events are usually FREE, but each individual usually pays about $6.00 - $30.00 for karaoke, food, and drink.

Time: The time varies.

Date: The date varies.

The Instructor:  Erik, the instructor is a Buddhist/Taoist, native English speaker, who engages the learners in fun and educational conversations.  

Place: We usually have this event in Manhattan, New York's Korea Town at an Asian Lounge or Karaoke club. 

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and you can check our Meetup page for the address and directions.

____________________________________________________________________________________________

ENGLISH CONVERSATION INTENSIVE FOR BANKERS, ECONOMISTS, AND FINANCE PROFESSIONALS!

Lessons:  This is our Intensive for Asian bankers, Asian economists, and Asian finance professionals.  You do not have to be a financial professional in order to join this meetup event! Asian English Learners who are interested in learning how to talk about money in English are allowed to come to the intensive.  We cover common Financial conversations, how to speak in English at meetings, financial terminology, and economic terms and ideas that are specific to the English language.  You are allowed to bring any materials and books that you would like to discuss. 

NO ENGLISH CONVERSATION EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

Price: This event is $25.00  We only have the intensive if 2 or more people register before the date of the Intensive.  We only allow 10 people to register for this event, so you should register early.

Time: 12 noon - 7pm  (If you can't make it at 12, you can drop in at anytime.)

Date: This event is repeated every month.

The Instructor:  Erik is the instructor for this Meetup.

Place:  This event is going to be in China Town or in Korea Town.

How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.   You can check our Meetup page for the address and directions.


 _______________________________________________________________________________________________

Hi Everybody,

When people come to the Meetup I usually say, "This is a really fun group.  Everybody has been very nice.  We enjoy talking to each other and it is an awesome way to meet people from many different Asian countries who are new to the city of Manhattan."  Don't be shy!  Come check us out and join us on a Saturday in order to find out for yourself.  We get many interesting men and women who enjoy talking, making new friends, and learning the English language.   - Erik

Thank you,

Erik

The English Language Instruction Meetup for Asians Organizer


Please be aware; The availability of English programs is subject to change at any time and the group only offers refunds if a Meetup is cancelled, not if you do not show up.
results.name: English Language Instruction Meetup for Asians!

results.description:
Welcome to the New York Asian Art, Asian Music, and Asian Hip Hop Meetup. 

The Group: This group was created to connect New York artists, Asian artists, Asian art fans, and Asian art collectors; with each other.   The groups goal is to create a stable social scene for Asian art appreciation and Asian art creation in New York.  We are creating relationships which are good for artists, casual art fans, and serious art industry professionals.  Though this group is made of many Asians, you do not need to be Asian to join this group.  Anybody is allowed to join and attend this groups events.  The only requirements being an interest in Asian Art and that you be respectful of the groups administration and its members.

The Art:  Anime, Asian Architecture, Asian Calligraphy (Including Asian Graffiti), Asian Dance, Asian Fashion, Asian Hip Hop (All 5 Elements), Asian Industrial Design,  Asian Interior Design,  Asian Music (Traditional and Modern), Asian Pop Culture (Chinese Pop, Japanese Pop, Korean Pop, Mongolian Pop, Taiwanese Pop), and Cosplay.

The Event Organizer:  Erik, the event organizer and an artist, is a Buddhist/Taoist.  Erik has experience being the organizer of 3 other Meetup groups for Asians.  Erik has created a passion for Asian Art, and religion by profession.  Erik is a teaches Buddhism, Taoism, and Kung Fu, in Manhattan, New York.  Erik has also worked in the New York art and music industry as a  professional.  Erik has over 6 years experience in the Electronic Music Industry, and over 10 years experience in the American Hip Hop industry.  Erik is a member of the New York Asian community, art scene, fashion scene, and is currently finishing the creation of a modern, religious based Buddhist/Taoist art portfolio.  Erik is also a talented Asian event promoter, and has hosted events in China Town, and Korea Town, in New York. 

The Events: Besides art trips and art lesson events, we are going to host; Asian Art Parties, Asian Art Gallery Shows, Asian Fashion Shows, and Asian Club Nights.  All members are encouraged to join us in creating our events.  If you have an event suggestion, please write Erik on the groups' home page.

_________________________________________________________________________________________________

ASIAN POP AND HIP HOP PARTY! 

In order to get face time in, relax, network, and build a thriving Asian Art scene in New York; we have a social event every month on the 3rd Saturday.  The location is TBA every month.  Please join us!

Time: 7pm until we have had enough.

Date: The third Saturday of every month.

Location: TBA 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________
results.name: New York Asian Art, Asian Music, and Asian Hip Hop Meetup!

A way for Asians to get connected in New York!

The group meets the 3rd Saturday of every month and randomly throughout the year.  We have an Asian music DJ that spins the latest and coolest Asian pop music and we are going to attend Asian cultural events around New York.

ALL ASIANS ARE WELCOME!  We would like all Asians to join this group.  This includes East Asians, Indians, and Asians of mixed ethnic families.

Time: 7:00pm til Whenever we end the party!

Date: The third Saturday of every month, with less formal meetings sporadically announced.

Place:  Clubs, Lounges, and Awesome locations around Manhattan, New York!

Thanks you for joining.  I look forward to meeting you!




Erik

Come join us for Saturday classes (beginners and advanced beginner levels).  Learn to dance the Sevillanas (The National Dance of Spain) at our next Sevillanas Night!  Class and contact info is on the website at www.josiedance.com.

Nous nous rassemblons une ou 2 fois par mois, soit le matin pour les maman qui ne travaillent pas ou le soir pour celles qui travaillent. Quelques soirées ou week end familiaux seront proposées durant l’année, des pique-nique –boules party, des visites de Musée, des gouters brioches et crêpes, des matins activités déco/peinture/activités mieux vivre bio, feng shui, discussion autour d’un film …et toutes les autres idées sont les bienvenues. results.description:
TalentTech is a community of tech enthusiasts who are passionate about cutting-edge talent development technologies, research and businesses, in New York (and soon beyond!). The community meets monthly during one hour events that include technology demos, the latest research, corporate case studies and networking. 

Our monthly events focus on various aspects of the TalentTech Revolution: 

- Upstarts (and start-ups) challenging/disrupting/redefining the underlying technologies used by organizations today to acquire, manage and develop talent locally and globally

- Thinkers who are tinkering with new management, leadership, engagement and motivation paradigms by investigating the data found at the intersection of software and hardware @work and @play

- Explorers focused on understanding how to leverage technology to integrate a global/distributed workforce that spans three generations - Boomers, GenXers, and Millenials 

TalentTech is an independent forum and is open to anyone with a genuine interest in the topic
results.name: Talentedly

results.description:
This is a group for men and women interested in exploring Active Insight in workshops and groups. Active Insight is great for those who wish to begin or expand a mindfulness meditation practice, but have some challenge with sitting in silence for long periods (I think we all do!).  

Most workshops and groups begin being devoted to guided meditation and sharing, with the last portion being an OPTIONAL time to explore meditation through the arts such as: writing, art making, game playing, movement and sometimes even activities like bowling or flying trapeze!

Each Meetup has a different focus but the activities are always optional after the meditation and sharing.

Benefits of Mindfulness:

-Decrease stress and compulsions. 

-Increase concentration and overall happiness.

Benefits of Active Mindfulness through Activities:

-Taking risks expands our stress tolerance.

-Increased awareness of inner barriers, leading to better relationships.

-Pushing through fear allows for great confidence!

See you soon Mindful Powerhouses!

Adrienne
results.name: Active Insight: An Active Meditation Practice

results.description:
OneTaste New York is a community of people who know the importance of practice who gather together to have honest conversations and add the element of practice to relationship, Orgasm, and intimacy. 

OneTaste  (www.onetaste.us) is a wellness/lifestyle technology company that promotes health, vitality, and connection through the innovative wellness practice of Orgasmic Meditation. 

Our MeetUp events are open to everyone and designed to introduce you to the wide spectrum of what's possible with Orgasm, our incredible community, and Orgasmic Meditation (OM). Orgasmic Meditation (OM) is a wellness practice (like yoga and pilates) that is designed for singles and couples to experience more connection, vitality, pleasure, and meaning in every aspect of their lives. 

You can participate at whatever level feels good to you. 

We're excited to meet you! 

Warmly,

The OneTaste New York Team

It is an honor to witness women being authentic, and striving to reach their greatest potential; utilize practices that bring a balanced and peaceful life in mind and body."

results.description:
Lady Savant is an Elite Women’s Private Society that brings together dynamic women who are committed to living life fully; that is, physically, mentally and spiritually. We believe that who you become in 5 years largely depends on who you associate yourself with and we are so proud of the supportive community of trailblazing women we have evolved into!

Our community boasts of women from all walks of life. From the mom-preneur to the business professional to the stay at home mom; our platform and unique community of “nice girls” creates genuine connections that support the creation and building of close relationships.

Our mission is to create new opportunities whether it is a play date or a new business connection among like minded women who have goals and want to live a “designer life”: that is, one of your own design! We believe you should ENVISION your story (and the ending it should have), EXPLORE life with friends, and EVOLVE in to the woman you dare and dream to be.

results.description:
"The only journey is the journey within"

This is a unique group incorporating mindfulness-meditation, expressive arts,  life coaching and various therapeutic techniques founded on the wellness model to promote health and wellbeing. 

This group is for you are interested in creating community with like-minded, heart-centered, men and women looking to live a wholehearted life from a grounded center. 

This group may be beneficial to you if you experience the following:

• intense stress or overwhelming feelings, 

• depression, low self-esteem and self-worth, 

• lack clarity & direction in your personal & professional life, 

• difficulties setting boundaries or saying no, 

• lack compassion for self and others, suffer from anxiety and stress related dis-ease,

• use ineffective and unhealthy strategies to cope with life challenges (i.e substance, food, sex, t.v, social media, spirituality, excercise)

• difficult interpersonal relationships

You will learn techniques and skills such as active meditation, mindfulness skills, meditation (active & sitting), movement, visualization, guided and unguided meditations, as well as use expressive arts modalities such as dance, music, art, painting, visual journaling and other experiential exercises to promote healing. 

The objective is to help you shift your state of mind from a place of "doingness" to a state of "beingness" -- grounded in love, clarity, peace, bliss and awakening. A place where you can make life choices that is authentic and aligned from a place of values, ownership, clarity, love and present-moment awareness. 

Master the whelm and live a life from a grounded center!


xo

Eva
results.name: Back-To-Being™: Journey To Center

results.description:
What is a "Rennie"?


In short: "Rennie" refers to people who are fans of Renaissance/Medieval Faires and Festivals.  We're not cast members, we're not market vendors...we're groupies.  Fans. Some are casual, only going once a year; others, like myself, go more often and have adopted a persona to portray (with outfit and accent to match) - but the main point is that we all love the magic of the Faire and that feeling as if we've gone back in time to an earlier place and century.

This group is meant to bring together people in the NYC area who have an interest in attending Renaissance Faires/Medieval Faires and related activities in and around city (or, for our purposes: Gotham.)  This includes our "home" festival in update Tuxedo Park, the New York Renaissance Faire, as well as those in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut.  It may also include events such as group outings to watch period or Fantasy related films and plays, or food and drink related to the early medieval-to late Renaissance eras.

Maybe you've thought about attending one, but don't know anyone else interested and don't want to go it alone.   Or perhaps you've gone in the past, or in another city, but don't have a regular group to go back with. Maybe you would just like to meet others here in the city with similar interests for ideas on costumes, weapons, or just general discussion on related topics. Or it could be you're just looking for information on who, where and when these types of events happen. 

Whatever your reason, join us! Cheer on your favorite knight, indulge in decadent ales, the sweetest meads and interesting foods, gander at the beautiful lords and ladies in their finest garb, join the dances, hear the music, enjoy the sights, scents, wares and entertainment of Medieval Gotham!

- Eric, aka Ariq ibn Rajih ibn Khali al Turkir
results.name: Gotham Rennies

results.description:
New York Business & Social Network

The Entrepreneurs, Professionals & Investors Network (EPI-Net) @ New York

We are 17,000 entrepreneurs, professionals and business owners with a variety of expertise and resources worldwide. We have built up quite a few active entrepreneurs communities globally in Silicon Valley, Toronto, London, Shanghai, Singapore, and else. Among us are also investors, recruiters, business owners, marketers, researchers, innovators, networkers, and graduate students.

Specialized groups and focus:

Social Media & Mobile Apps (Tech/Marketing/E-Commerce)

Mobile, Clouds & Emerging Technologies (Hi-Tech/3D)

Green (Energy & Environmental), Internet Security & Privacy, Biomedical (Health & Beauty Industries)...

Investors & Mentors | Young Professionals (TYPE)

Marketing & Branding | Startup/Dream Builders | GLOBAL IMPACTS


Affiliated Groups: Dream BIG (50,000 members worldwide)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The dreamers and the entrepreneurs, not government, built this economy, and they can once again make it strong. ~ Mitt Romney

Modern day startup do not necessarily need a lot of money. Rather, the key ingredients are the energy and talents of like-minded people as well as know-how and enabling resources. This group is for those of us dreamers with big ideas, who have actually been doing something to build up dreams, and ready for others (investors, mentors, or co-founders) to help make our dreams come true.

This group is about a combination of talented people, young or seasoned, with the ability to build the next big thing on the Internet or mobile world, and to change the world for better. The group will have technical, marketing, and content contributors, focused on a few topics at a time, with specific goals in mind.

Big dreams need not be restricted to Silicon Valley. With the talents and diversity of New Yokers, let's prove that we can build startups, and make something big that benefits the world.

A cool group of talents with lots of ambitions

Who do we have amongst us?

- Entrepreneurs & Innovators

- Engineers & Programmers

- Marketers & Financial Analysts

- Social Media Experts & Web Designers

- Investors & Mentors

- Tech Enthusiasts & Frontiers

- Legal & Insurance Professionals

- Researchers & Graduate students

Chris

Ph.D. in Electrical & Computer Engineering

International social entrepreneur

Organizer for EPI-Net, & else

E-mail: chris.meetup at hotmail.com


Together, We Can Achieve Something Great--Individually & Collectively

Core Values:

Life: Healthy, Successful, Fulfilling & Enjoyable

Achievement: Change the World for the Better While Making a Fortune

Social entrepreneurship:

Identifying or recognizing a social problem and using entrepreneurial principles to organize, create, and manage a social venture to achieve a desired social change.

Business entrepreneurs typically measure performance in profit and return, but social entrepreneurs also take into account a positive return to society.

Global collaboration for a better world:

Social entrepreneurship practiced in a world or international context is called international social entrepreneurship.

(Modified from Wikipedia)
results.name: New York Entrepreneurs

"As aspiring Software Craftsmen we are raising the bar of professional software development by practicing it and helping others learn the craft. Through this work we have come to value:

Not only working software, but also well-crafted software

Not only responding to change, but also steadily adding value

Not only individuals and interactions, but also a community of professionals

Not only customer collaboration, but also productive partnerships

That is, in pursuit of the items on the left we have found the items on the right to be indispensable. "

Software Craftsmanship New York approaches Software Craftsmanship from a modern, freestyle, pragmatic way while keeping the values in focus.

We welcome developers, business analysts, project managers at any level who are interested in improving their skills via discussing interesting topics, challenging themselves with hands-on sessions, learning Test Driven Development, practicing katas, peeking into new technologies, languages and meeting with software professionals and thinkers who enjoy developing software and care about what they do.

results.description: Entrepreneurs are pitching all the time.  And there's some really interesting research showing how we can do it a little bit better.  The starting point though is understanding the purpose of a pitch.  Now I used to think that the purpose of a pitch was basically to convert the other side.  You do a little vaudeville routine, ba da da da, and then they agree with you.  That's not right.  There's some great research out of the University of California Davis and Stanford.  And what they found is the most effective pitchers didn't think of their pitch as an attempt to convert.  They looked at it as an invitation to collaborate.  It was an invitation, come on in with me and work on this idea, share with me your ideas on how we can make this better.  That's what a pitch is.  So don't think of it as an attempt to convert, think of it as an invitation to collaborate.
results.name: Pitch Your Startup (LIVE!)

Our sons/daughters go bowling, to the movies, plays, tubing, hiking, have even walked Manhattan's West Side bike path, and many drive. While family members often help plan outings, and arrange transportation for non-driving members, the young adults already possess the social skills to enjoy themselves without the presence of parents/caregivers. Please note, if you, your young adult, has more significant needs, this may not be the appropriate group, as we do not have any professional staff, just people gathering together for social time. Whether the goal is to help people save more money, get in shape, cut down on electricity usage, or learn a new language, the idea is the same:  how can we use research in behavioral economics and psychology to help users build habits and change their daily behavior?

results.description:
Who We Are

Education Idea Exchange NYC is a community of Educators, Entrepreneurs, Designers and Developers (as well as other Education Disruptors) who come together to foster innovation and disruption in the education space. This meetup is organized by 4.0 Schools, a nonprofit that brings together a similar community of people experimenting with new ideas in education -- from educators, entrepreneurs and creative technologists to parents and students.

Our Monthly Event 

In the first part of the night, 3-5 members working on an education venture or experiment share their progress, and get* feedback and help from the other meetup members. In the second half of the night, we open the floor for members to share what they can give* or what they need to get* (expertise, connections, feedback, etc).

get*:
• Feedback on your idea / prototype / MVP / venture
• People excited enough about your idea to join your team
• Connected to the 4.0 community (and the wider education disruption community in NYC)

give*:
• Your perspective on a problem and a potential solution 
 • Advice (pedagogy, problem validation, customer dev, feedback loops, product, etc)
 • Skills/time to ideas and people that really resonate with you
 • Access to your own network

If interested in sharing your venture or experiment, please fill out this form.
results.name: Education Idea Exchange NYC

Share nail art, ideas, meet and greet, network within the industry

We will hold local shows at area venues to create opportunities to display your work and creativity! 

What better way to celebrate life than with beautiful nails, your best heels and of course a cocktail? It all started a few years ago in a nail salon. I loved the way my nails looked after they got done, but I hated waiting for the nail polish to dry. So I would buy the nail polish and try to polish them myself… Walah! Nail polish addict I became! How did the heels and cocktails come in? I wanted to make it a complete componet and lifestyle. Women love to have beautiful nails, gorgeous shoes and they love to go out. When they go out with their girlfriends they usually have cocktails! Hence The birth of Glam Nails, Heels and Cocktails.

Marsha B.

I love potlucks- I don't think there's any better way to meet people and really connect than over food in a private home or apartment. I joined many potluck groups, but noticed almost all of them were for vegans or vegetarians. I wanted to make a more generalized potluck and dinner party group that includes non-vegetarians too. I myself am a former vegetarian (6 years) but still enjoy cooking vegetable and whole grain loaded foods, in addition to meat, poultry and seafood.

 I also have a huge space perfect for entertaining. Problem is, it's 30 minutes out in Brooklyn. I definitely want to get some dinner party mileage in at my place, but I would imagine at some point other members of the group would offer to host at their places, which may be more convenient for all.

results.description:
The purpose & agenda of the group is to get a group of members to get together and ride!  My close buddy of mine has started the group in Boston which I am apart of and I wanted to expand it to the NYC area as well. The Big Event of the year that we ALL must go to is the Brooklyn Invitational venue that takes place in Williamsburg area of Brooklyn with the Indian Larry's Bike Shop.

This group will accept and be comprised of all types of Bikes.  Whether you have a Harley, Ducati, Victory, Gxser, Yamaha, Cafe Racer, Chopper or any other type of bike especially something Custom.  All Races, genders, religions will be accepted..   The only Rule..  Safe Riding.. No Stupid shit!.   We'll base out of a huge lot off the Belt Pkwy (Exit 5) behind the Wendy's in the BestBuy parking lot.

<b style="font-size : 16px">From Spring to late fall, on Friday nights, the lot fills with Custom cars, muscle cars, and all types of Bikes.  from like 7pm to 2am..   All levels of experience welcome as well.. 

Name of group comes from DICE Magazine..  Heres the link if youre interested..  

Dice Magazine "Fuck this Lets Ride"

 Welcome and introduce yourself..  We'll have short and long trips & events as soon as the weather permits.   Ride on & Safe!!   Peace.  "Venti"

results.description:
Come join us for our weekly NYC Small Business Owners, Consultants & Salespeople meetup.  These meetings promise to be fun, full of energy & productive!

We differentiate ourselves from all other groups by not only introducing ourselves to the group but also by acting as a small business advisory group. Need help with a business problem or issue? We can help. We have been together for over 15 years and are always growing. Come join us.

We believe in fostering entrepreneurship by building communities of startup-minded people through social and business oriented events. NYC Entrepreneurs meets and hosts weekly and monthly events where entrepreneurs connect in a relaxed yet productive way. We meet for breakfast most Thursday mornings in midtown NYC and every THIRD (or fourth) THURSDAY of the month at a local restaurant/bar/pub.

We are going to be meeting for happy hour every month at Ainsworth Park - 6-8PM
111 East 18th Street @Park Ave South (ask for the meetup or Raphi Salem)

We can help you promote your company, services, generate leads and sell your products. We welcome salespeople, entrepreneurs, individual practitioners and representatives of companies large and small. We promote businesses within the group, awareness of each other’s professions, and educate each other to help increase individual success. We grow our business through relationships, networking, and referrals. RSVP here: (Payment of $20.00 must be made in advance of all meetings via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA - or you can pay $25.00 at the door with cash or check. The $500.00 annual membership fee entitles you to exclusive membership with no competition.)

Schedule for 2015 (Thursdays)

Breakfast @AXA - 8-9:30
Lunch @Citrin Cooperman - 12:30-2PM
Happy Hours @Ainsworth Park - 6-8PM

Oct 8 & Lunch, 15 & Happy Hr, 22
Nov 12 & Lunch, 19 & Happy Hr, 26 is Thanksgiving (no mtg)
Dec 10 & Lunch, 17 & Happy Hr, 24

We have been around since 2000 and have generated millions of dollars in leads and closed business. We are primarily seasoned veterans but welcome young go-getters.

We are similar to many other groups in that we are a roundtable forum and everyone gets to give their :60 second pitch. But then we go deeper into your business in our "advisory" round where we dive into your business issues and act as your own personal advisory board.

We can help you:

- develop a sales plan

- develop a marketing plan

- with finances

- with HR issues

- secure speaking engagements

- become aware of other marketing and sales opportunities, trade shows and advertising mediums

- meet other key people and partners

- get more referrals!

Call Raphi Salem (212-222-3292) today to find out more or to RSVP for any of our monthly events.


Most events take place on Thursday mornings (the 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday of every month) at 8-9:30AM. Networking takes place from 8-8:15. The actual meeting and introductions are between 8:15 and 9:30. And then there is more networking after the meeting until 10AM. Once in a while we will gather for happy hour at a local bar, tavern, restaurant or lounge.


Cost: Annual Membership is $500. This entitles you to attend all meetings without having to pay the $20 per meeting fee. (Payment must be made in advance via paypal here:

http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA) or to payments {at} salemglobal.com or $25/cash at the door.)

Sponsors: We are always looking for sponsors. Would you like to sponsor our group? Thank you to Paul Berkman of AXA Advisors for helping us secure the conference room for our meetup. He is the best in the business. Come on down to meet him!


Location: AXA Advisors

1290 Avenue of the Americas, 16th Floor

(You must RSVP in order to get on the security list)


We look forward to seeing you at our next Breakfast or other Networking event.


Raphi Salem (212-222-3292)

Please contact me if you have any thoughts, comments, suggestions etc:

Raphi Salem
SalemGlobal Internet
www.SalemGlobal.com
917-862-8929

results.description:
Lady Savant is an Elite Women’s Private Society that brings together dynamic women who are committed to living life fully; that is, physically, mentally and spiritually.  We believe that who you become in 5 years largely depends on who you associate yourself with and we are so proud of the supportive community of trailblazing women we have evolved into!

Our community boasts of women from all walks of life.  From the mom-preneur to the business professional to the stay at home mom; our platform and unique community of “nice girls” creates genuine connections that support the creation and building of close relationships.

Our mission is to create new opportunities whether it is a play date or a new business connection among like minded women who have goals and want to live a “designer life”:  that is, one of your own design!  We believe you should ENVISION your story (and the ending it should have), EXPLORE life with friends, and EVOLVE in to the woman you dare and dream to be.  Find your passion in life. Feel fulfilled. Feel pretty. Feel powerful.  Make a new girlfriend (or five).  The Lady Savant Community is here to help you on your journey.

Our Lady Savants connect and collaborate through private events, an online forum,  and one on one interaction through Savanting Circles (mastermind group). Our members have access to a vast network of women from a multitude of various professions and life experiences. Establishing relationships within this network opens doors and stimulates conversation resulting in the creation of new ideas and close bonds. We are a community that believes in and supports the power of the female spirit.

Are you asking yourself is Lady Savant the right club for you?  If you answer YES to any of the questions below then you are in the right place:

** I want to be inspired to do something more, but I don’t know exactly what?

** I want to make true friendships.

** I need to network and meet other women business owners.

** I don’t work, but I want to learn and explore other options out there.

** I like to volunteer and help others.

** I want to take up a hobby or learn about new trades.

** I like to buy local and support women in following their passions.

** I want to find myself and passions:  spiritually, physically, and mentally.

If you answered YES to any of these questions, Lady Savant is right for you!  Come to our next event (you may attend one event before applying for membership), meet some of the amazing members, and join !  Don’t let another day slip away….this could be the door to your next Chapter in your life.
results.name: Lady Savant: An Elite Women's Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Welcome! We're a group of young women who get together monthly in a small group (10-15 ladies) to discuss a good book and enjoy some wine. We also occassionally have "no reading required" events in addition to regular book club meetings to include more members and try something new! If you're interested in meeting some new friends, please join us!

Fast Facts:

-Meetups are the second Wednesday of each month.

-It's not necessary that you finish the book by the meetup, but be prepared for some spoilers!

-Most of us eat dinner during the meetup, so feel free to come hungry.

-We're really a very fun and friendly group, so if you're on the fence, give us a shot!

Ground Rules:

-Members who don't attend a meetup after RSVP-ing yes and failing to change their RSVP to no will be removed after three such "no-shows."

-Inactive members (not in attendance at any meetups) will be removed after 6 months of inactivity.


2015 Book List:

January- The Snow Child by Eowyn Ivey

February- Billy Lynn’s Long Halftime Walk by Ben Fountain

March- Thirteen Reasons Why by Jay Asher (Thanks for the recommendation Ashley and Kate!)

April- The Language of Flowers by Vanessa Diffenbaugh

May- The Art of Hearing Heartbeats by Jan-Philipp Sendker

September- The Sound of Things Falling by Juan Gabrial Vasquez

October- Drowning Ruth by Christina Schwarz

November- The Round House by Louise Erdich

2016 Book List

December- Moriarty by Anthony Horowitz

results.description:
The main goal of Ladies of Gotham is to create a safe space for women to get together and play board/card games. Our group is trans, cis, and genderfluid friendly; it is open and welcome to all women and all persons who fall outside of the gender binary.

Are you new to board gaming? Or maybe a seasoned pro? All levels of experience are welcome! Our meetups will be a chance for members to share their favorite games as well as learn some new ones. This group is a great opportunity to make some new friends over some of the best games out there. 

In order to ensure a safe space for you, our anti-harrassment policy is as follows:

Ladies of Gotham Board Gaming is dedicated to providing a harassment-free safe space for all of its members, regardless of gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of members in any form or from any source, be it from within the group or outside of it.

Members that feel like their experience/safety with the group has been compromised are encouraged to contact the organizer(s) directly. A member of this meetup is entitled to support and help from this group’s organizing team. As well as privacy and confidentiality with any and all issues reported to organizers as the reporting member(s) sees fit.

Members (or organizers) violating this code of conduct may be expelled from the group at the discretion of the group’s organizing team. 

(This anti-harassment policy is based on the example policy from the Geek Feminism wiki, created by the Ada Initiative and other volunteers.

http://geekfeminism.wikia.com/wiki/Conference_anti-harassment)

Meetups run 1-2 times monthly with a variety of different games played at each meetup. Suggestions for games are always appreciated!

Donations to the meetup group go towards paying yearly Meetup subscription fees. Any excess amount goes towards purchasing games. 

Have a game you like that's already been played in the past? Let me know so I know to put it back into the rotation soon.
results.name: Ladies of Gotham Board Gaming

POLICY

Profitable Teaching is a tight network of support for teaching individuals and startups – a new wave of entrepreneurs creating great content, and growing their own online courses to change the world (and make some money along the way too). 

This event series is a joint venture between:
- A select group of teaching startups who've grown their own audiences and are looking to better engage and monetize their audience with online courses in New York City.
- Fedora, the platform that allows anyone to launch their own online courses.
- A braintrust of new teacher entrepreneurs, getting started with their own part-time or full-time online education businesses.

Our content will center around:
1. Turning your experience into GREAT content.
2. Growing an online audience, even if you don't have experience.
3. Making change (as in cash money) with online courses.

results.description:
Self-Inquiry work helps us to apply spiritual insights to our lives.  We practice in a group to build community and support each other.  This practice helps deepen meditation, self-knowledge and connection with others.   

This group is open to all who desire self-knowledge and an authentic spiritual path.  We offer a direct route to access your inner world.  We offer the opportunity and the tools to help you speak from that place.  

We meet weekly.  We begin with a guided meditation, sharing and a group self-inquiry process in which we support each other with our words.  We use a specific process for the group self-inquiry.  I learned this process from Swami Shankarananda who is located in Australia.  Detailed information about this process can be found in the "Pages" section of this Meetup.  Recommended books for self-inquiry are "Happy for No Good Reason" and "Self Inquiry,"  both by Swami Shankarananda.   

Please feel free to "Like" our Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/nyshivayoga.
results.name: Self-Inquiry Meditation & Sharing

results.description:
Welcome to Brighton Beach Wing Chun Academy!

Wing Chun is one of the best self defense martial arts in the world. It is known for it's efficiency and effectiveness. Wing Chun is not a competitive sport, as it's principles are geared entirely for combat. Please come on in and try this wonderful martial art for yourself! New Members get 2 week Free Trial! 

Our lineage is Ip Man-> Leung Ting -> Keith R. Kernshpect->Emin Boztepe.

Our address is: 330 Neptune Ave. Brooklyn, NY 11235

We meet every Tuesday and Thursday at 7 PM - 9 PM.  

Saturday classes are from 12:30 PM -  2:30 PM are by the bandstand at Asser Levy Park.

The classes are $120 per month.

Please checkout our past Meetup pictures, or take a look and like our Facebook page!

Foundation of Wing Chun:

According to Grand Master Yip Man, Wing Chun was developed by Ng Mui, who was Abbess at the Henan Shaolin Monastery and managed to survive its destruction by Qing forces during the reign of the Kangxi Emperor (1662–1722). She fled to the White Crane Temple (somewhere in the Daliang mountains between Yunnan and Sichuan), where she met a girl of fifteen named Yim Wing-Chun whom a bandit was trying to force into marriage. Ng Mui taught Wing-Chun how to defend herself by distilling Shaolin martial art knowledge into a system that Wing-Chun could learn quickly and use without developing great strength.

To see what Wing Chun Kung Fu actually looks like in action, please do a YouTube search for IP Man.
results.name: Brighton Beach Wing Chun Kung Fu Meetup, NYC

results.description:
This is a group for women interested in being healthy and fit for the summer months.

It is beginning this Sunday 03/02 and continues through Sunday 04/20. It will run for 7 wks. Each week, I will schedule a meetup on that Sunday to celebrate our achievements. It will either be at Bottagra in Hawthorne or Kafe Neo in Totowa. If you can’t make the event on Sunday, you can still participate.

If you RSVP “YES” for the event, then you are signing up to be Fit that week and that week only. It’s a confirmation you are making saying “Yes I will try to live healthier and loose weight.”

Once you RSVP yes, you will then be required to post in advance by day (Sun-Sat) in the comments section of the event:

1) Your meal plan (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, and a snack) 2) Your planned 30-40 minute exercise for that day. Studies show:

1) Small steps are best when trying to change your life so let’s do it week by week. 2) If you plan your meals in advance you are more likely to stick with the plan. 3) If you schedule time for exercise then you are more likely to stick with it. 4) If you have a group of people with the same goal doing the same thing then you are more likely to stay with it. 5) If you give yourself a moment to celebrate what you accomplished instead of wishing away your failures, you are more likely to be successful.

After posting, no one is to comment negatively on anyone else’s post. Or, you will be thrown out of the group.

I am RSVP’ing so look for my plan in the comments tonight. It will also work as example of what you are suppose to do once you say “YES.”

Love to All..Good Luck…And I hope you join.

Michele

results.description:
Piano Outreach of New York provides scholarships to children who cannot afford the cost of group lessons (much less the cost of private lessons). PONY allows its students to benefit from the same excellent, conservatory-trained musicians who teach the paying students of the Piano School of New York.

PONY's scholarships cover 50-80% of the cost of the lessons, with parents, schools or PTAs making up the difference. Class size is small: three to six students. Piano-playing skills, note reading and writing, ear training, and rhythm are taught, together with music history. Each class is designed to meet the children.s individual needs according to their ages, and all children are introduced to a wide range of music, from sacred choral works of the Renaissance to 20th century jazz. PONY classes are educational, inspiring, and just plain fun! Each student receives individual piano instruction at every session, performs for and with classmates, and plays duets with their teachers. Year-end recitals at Alfred Lerner Hall at Columbia University provide a tremendous incentive and are highly rewarding to all participating students.

PONY was incorporated in 2003 and has been approved by the IRS as a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization. It is an outgrowth of the Piano School of New York, which since its founding in 2001 has experienced extraordinary growth. Today more than 1500 children in over 60 public, parochial, and nursery schools throughout the City are enrolled in our group classes. At a time when spending on the arts in schools has been drastically cut back, the Piano School and the Piano Outreach actually bring the only music into many schools in New York City. In fact, The Piano School of New York has been placing pianos and/or keyboards in schools where no instrument is available.
results.name: Piano Outreach of New York

Hi Everyone!  Welcome.

My vision for this group = "grown-up gym class" for anyone 26 and older.

Purpose:  To get together at least once/week for a pick-up game involving a different activity each time, with the emphasis on making fitness fun - basically, to get outside and play! Activities that come to mind, or have been mentioned - ultimate frisbee, touch football, paintball, basketball, hiking, soccer, scavenger hunt, volleyball, kickball, paddleboarding - all tbd based on group interest, always open to suggestions.

You do not need to be from North Jersey, but I live in the Montclair area, so field/court activities will be in one of the parks within a reasonable distance (approx 20-30 min = from Bloomfield to Morristown etc).  There will be other activities (kayaking, paddleboarding) that may require further travel.

The first rule of Fit Club = talk about Fit Club - the more the merrier

Please note:  this is an activities based fitness group, all fitness levels are welcome, but please know your own personal limitations based on the activity for that day.  Joining this group is done so on a voluntary basis, and by doing so, you accept all responsibility for your actions, including any injuries that may occur. 

Update 6/1/15:  There is now a one-time $5 (or $6) fee to join NJFC.  Please read the NJFC document under the "More" tab, then "files."  And, please bear with me during the transition - this process kicked off approx 500+ members (mostly inactive) but it will take some time to rebuild in order to get big group activities planned again.

Thank you.

Holly

We are a SparringClub.com affiliated local sparring club dedicated to providing trained martial artists with opportunities to test and refine your skills through respectful, productive sparring.

This is a group for martial artists of sound mind and good character who would like to occasionally meet up and spar with others from various styles to test and refine their skills in an energetic, supportive, sportsmanlike environment. This group is for men and women 18 and older of all fighting styles with at least 1 year of formal martial arts training under a qualified instructor.

This is NOT a class, training course, fitness group, or seminar. We do not meet to "cross-train" or swap techniques. This is NOT a "fight club". Brawling and showing lack of reasonable control/restraint will not be tolerated. Maintaining the right group culture is essential. 

You must officially register before you can participate in sparring.  Register by joining www.SparringClub.com.

Sessions will be respectful ("friendly") but also combative, meaning you should expect your partner to actively engage you. We use light or medium contact (holding back power, showing restraint when partner takes hard blow, certain kinds of strikes prohibited). Mandatory protective gear and rules are set and collectively enforced. You must be willing to sign a waiver accepting full liability for injury and sole responsibility for your own protection and safety. <br>

Spread the Word!  Like Us on FACEBOOK

Click here to go to our DC/Maryland Meetup Group

results.description:
This is a development-centric meetup group for mobile .NET development with a primary focus on Xamarin.  We welcome all skill levels as well as those with no experience at all.  Anyone interested in joining a vibrant community and deeply understanding the Xamarin platform is a great fit.  We will engage in actual development projects, with the entire team focusing on a particular problem, architecting and developing in tandem, and then comparing results with the team as a whole.  We will use best-in-class development tools such as: Xamarin Studio, GitHub, XCode, Visual Studio, SQLite, Amazon Cloud, Cassandra/HBase NoSQL, AngularJS, Node.js, etc.  The huge upside is that while we develop on the core technologies, we'll also be building up our skillset with highly effective and marketable ancillary technologies. 

The format of the group will be as follows: 

We'll meet as an entire group and define what we'd like to build in the upcoming sprint (we might as well use Agile terms).  The project definitions will be fairly narrow, especially in the early phases of the group while we're developing our nascent skills. So for example, we may say, "This week we'll build the map screen for a simple mapping application that supports push-pins, on iOS".  

We'll then break the group into teams of 2, attempting to balance out our experience and talent levels as well as possible.   After that point, we'll all go away and dive into the code.  Each group of two will work on the project for the duration of the sprint. We'll create an environment of open collaboration by way of an online project management tool.  

The following meetup will then serve as a code review where we will conduct the following exercises as a group: 

1) Compare architectural decisions and defend reasons for making those decisions

2) Discuss extensions and other third-party components used to aid development

3) Discuss your greatest pain points, or where you flat out hit a brick wall

4) Attempt to gain consensus on the best methods of accomplishing each of the tasks, and compile those methods into a best-practices reference

5) Merge our best code into a common area, and promote that version as group-certified (it's probably very ambitious to try to accomplish this during an actual Meetup)

Then we'll define the next project, and re-start the development cycle.  We can either completely start over with an altogether different project, or build new components onto the existing one, gradually working our way towards an enterprise-worthy app.  

One great thing about these short development sprints is that we can always bring on new developers at any one of our Meetups.
results.name: NJ Mobile .NET Developers

results.description:
Mission:

Women Who Code is a global nonprofit organization dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers by creating a global, connected community of women in technology. The organization tripled in 2013 and has grown to be one of the largest communities of women engineers in the world.

Empowerment:

Women Who code is a professional community for women in tech. We provide an avenue for women to pursue a career in technology, help them gain new skills and hone existing skills for professional advancement, and foster environments where networking and mentorship are valued.

Key Initiatives:

Free technical study groups

Events featuring influential tech industry experts and investors

Hack events

Career and leadership development

Current and aspiring coders are welcome. 

Bring your laptop and a friend! 

Support Women Who Code:

Donating to Women Who Code, Inc. (#46-4218859) directly impacts our ability to efficiently run this growing organization, helps us produce new programs that will increase our reach, and enables us to expand into new cities around the world ensuring that women and girls everywhere have the opportunity to pursue a career in technology.

Women Who Code (WWCode) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or socioeconomic status. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc. If you would like to report an incident or contact our leadership team, please submit an incident report form.

WomenWhoCode.com

results.description:
In 1826 Josiah Holbrook organized the Millbury Branch Number 1 of the American Lyceum with the goal of bringing lifelong education through presentation and spirited debate to everyone. Mr. Holbrook’s great hope was to bring about a general and universal diffusion of knowledge regardless of age, gender or station. Taking the name “Lyceum” from Aristotle’s school, Mr. Holbrook’s efforts resulted in the organization of thousands of local Lyceums and the brief formation of a National Lyceum.

At Axial, we agree strongly with Mr. Holbrook that education is a lifelong exercise. We believe that curiosity and ingenuity are critically important and that you should engage in debate with friends, colleagues and experts on a variety of topics frequently and vigorously.

In the spirit of the 19th century Lyceum movement, we invite domain experts to our offices every month to give a presentation or participate in a panel discussion. Our doors are open to anyone interested in joining the debate (and of course, there’s always the free Sixpoint). 

The Axial Corps of Engineers is a team of technologists dedicated to pragmatically and predictably shipping innovative software. Some people would say we’re flip-floppers, but we reserve the right to change our minds when new evidence is presented. The best argument, implementation or design on any given day is the one we’ll favor at Axial, not the one coming from the person with the highest rank, title or most pull. We value practical consideration and self-restraint backed by solid communication over rockstars, samurais and ninjas.

We’ll use a framework, tool, language or approach as soon as it becomes obvious that it’s well supported, stable, low maintenance and the right tool for the job.

*We kindly ask that agency recruiters refrain from attending.

**If you feel like you have a relevant talk that you'd like to present, send some information over to alex.steinberg@axial.net.
results.name: Axial Lyceum

If you are one of those who gets energy while writing in cafes and libraries, or people places, this may be for you. I invite you to try it!

results.description: This is a group for misfits. Misfits of all kinds. It's called unusual because it refers to a special kind of misfit, where you are not necessarily a misfit in all aspects of your life, but one or more of them and you feel really unusual, awkward or inexplicable about why you were not able to fit in. For example, it could be at work, in your family, or in your dating life with same/opposite sex, or your surrounding society. These are the people who are waiting to fit into those areas that they always had trouble fitting in, but wanted to fit in. I understand that the name 'misfits' is used in television/movie titles, but I have never watched any of them. So, just to be clear, this group is not an imitation or is not inspired by any sort of fiction. We can discuss our issues as to why we are not able to fit in those certain areas of life - probably come up with a solution or just laugh it off and move on. Either way, you know that there's a group of people out there that feel something similar to what you feel.
results.name: Unusual Misfits

Aurore

results.description:
This is the meet up group for Hekates Sacred Temple-Torchbearer of the Crossroads.  This is a place for anyone whether or not they already belong to a Coven, Group or Solitary to come together as Devotees of Hekate to worship Her in a safe environment. To make this  Temple a strong member of the NY Pagan Community.

We have been sanctioned by New York State as a Non-Profit Religious Organization with all the rights and privileges that a legal non-profit in the state has.  By the law only non profit religious organizations are authorized to hold public services  

Hekate’s Sacred Temple-Torchbearer of the Crossroads Mission Statement:

We are a Hekatean Wiccan/ Pagan Coven whose Matron Goddess is Hekate. We honor Her in all of our rites and rituals and we also honor  Deities that are associated with Hekate. Though we are Pagan we believe and follow some Wiccan Principles, they are the following:The Wiccan Rede, the Rule of Three and the Thirteen Principles of Witchcraft. To promote the practice and understanding of Pagan, Wiccan and all  Earth-centered traditions.  To welcome all   Pagans and those  who do not consider themselves Pagans. We also welcome Pagans and inquirers who are not members of Hekate's Sacred Temple but who will act in accordance with our principles. To hold regular rituals. We celebrate the Dark/New Moon, all Eight Sabats on The Wheel of the Year as we as all of Hekate's Festival Days.
 To explore and celebrate in a safe and supportive environment the teachings and wisdom of Hekate and Pagan/Wiccan traditions.  To share, teach, learn, and explore by modeling, by mentoring, by demonstration, by oral and written traditions, and by workshops and classes. To affirm each other as we each follow our own individual spiritual path through this life. We maintain an environment that is safe, physically, emotionally, and spiritually. We respect boundaries and comfort levels of self and others. 

Our Board of Trustees are:

Rev. Alexandra Morrigan Raven - High Priestess of Hekate

Lady Morgana of Avallone - High Priestess of Hekate

Michael Houze - High Priest

If you would like to know about any of the above, please go to the Temple's website:

www.hekatesacredtemple.org
results.name: Hekates Sacred Temple-Torchbearer of The Crossroads

Two types of New York City, New Jersey, Long Island, and Westchester walks are offered:

(1) The organizer will talk a lot about architecture, history, and sculpture. These are walking tours that will stop at a number of points of interests and last about 2 1/4 hours. During the walking tour, you will still have some time to socialize with others.

(2) The organizer will offer some commentary, but you will have plenty of time to socialize with others in the group and enjoy the scenery. These are sociable walks (not walking tours) that go through historic neighborhoods, along scenic waterfronts, in public parks, and to artist studios, historic houses and festivals.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The cost of each event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you have any questions for one of the organizers, you can contact that organizer through her/his private Meetup inbox. The organizer is the event host who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are registered for a walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". This might allow someone else to go. There is no need to post why you can't make the event.

A member who incurs an excessive number of no-shows will be removed from this group and not be allowed to attend events. Thank you for your cooperation. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please go in the Pages Tab and read the liability waiver. Thank you again.

This group is specifically for the girly, feminine, lipstick, heels, dress wearing lesbian femme and  girly Bi femme who  "are" dating  or want to date a femme as equally dolled up and frilly as herself.  We do exist  and it's time we cultivate our own community  of  "femme for Femme" , The venues & details of our meet ups are announced to members only.

This is a closed group so your photos will be seen only by members in our group.  

Calling all single, career professional, "classy",  " ladies" to post your photos and bio. Suggest events and activities for us to enjoy. 

Girly femmes from the 5 boroughs of New York City, long Island and the tri-State area all welcomed! 


Single femmes & Ladies in femme to femme relationships are welcome to enjoy our monthly Sunday brunch & monthly girl talk meet ups.


Reasons for members being removed  from this group include but are not limited to :  

1.  Unpaid member dues

2. Behaviors  adversely affecting  group morale.

3. Profiles without a photo of your face.

4. Photos that do not represent what you look like ( eg, pets, food, flowers)


Please disregard the meetup default setting that says dues are optional. This is a community supported group, all of our members pay monthly dues.

Membership dues: only $2 each month. Payment is made online. 

Please make first payment at the time you join the group. "No refund" policy for member dues.  


Please do invite your girly Bi and  girly Lesbian friends to join you at our meet ups 

To  RSVP  for our events, members must be current in late- unpaid  membership dues. 

The venue details of our meet ups is for members only. 


Join Us!

Sunshine

Organizer

results.description:
Over the next three months we will be meeting with residents, artists, and community leaders to use photography to document our community for an online and 63rd drive underpass exhibition. We will also be asking individuals to lend their voices to a larger underpass movement where they will document underpasses in NYC and put them on Instagram. As our voices grow, attention to the issue will grow. Together we will change underpasses that run through the hubs of our communities.

You can get involved in a number of ways.

1. Join our meet-up group and come to an event

2.Rate your Underpass. By letting us know which underpasses in the community you aren't happy with.  If we have enough voices behind a particular underpass we can take the Underpass Art Movement to more locations

Information on how to rate  your underpass can be found here. (It's Easy) http://www.regoparkgreenalliance.org/#!rete-my-underpass/c10fc

3. Like our new Facebook page Underpass Art Movement

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Underpass-Art-Movement-NYC/643844632353049

4. Tell and share the Underpass Art Movement with your friends, family and colleagues.

The Underpass Art Movement is hosted by Rego Park Green Alliance. You can see some of the other project we are involved with by visiting our website.

http://www.regoparkgreenalliance.org/
results.name: Underpass Art Movement

results.description: Hello! We are tarot enthusiasts starting this New York tarot meetup group for fellow learners of all levels and backgrounds. Notebooks, pens and scarves (to protect your cards) optional! *Along with discussion, the events will include exercises, handouts and optional homework (if you so choose to accept the challenge!). We look forward to meeting you! Ellie

results.description:
Mission:

Women Who Code is a global nonprofit organization dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers by creating a global, connected community of women in technology. The organization tripled in 2013 and has grown to be one of the largest communities of women engineers in the world.

Empowerment:

Women Who code is a professional community for women in tech. We provide an avenue for women to pursue a career in technology, help them gain new skills and hone existing skills for professional advancement, and foster environments where networking and mentorship are valued.

Key Initiatives:

Free technical study groups

Events featuring influential tech industry experts and investors

Hack events

Career and leadership development

Current and aspiring coders are welcome. 

Bring your laptop and a friend! 

Support Women Who Code:

Donating to Women Who Code, Inc. (#46-4218859) directly impacts our ability to efficiently run this growing organization, helps us produce new programs that will increase our reach, and enables us to expand into new cities around the world ensuring that women and girls everywhere have the opportunity to pursue a career in technology.

Women Who Code (WWCode) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or socioeconomic status. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc. If you would like to report an incident or contact our leadership team, please submit an incident report form.

WomenWhoCode.com

Twitter | Facebook

This is a group for anyone interested in learning about and sharing their knowledge of web design, web marketing, and the growing number of tools, frameworks, and philosophies that makes the whole thing work. All skill levels are welcomed. 

The focus of the group is two-fold.

1. To provide an opportunity to meet and speak with others in the field.

2. To create a pool of talent accessible to all.

Bottom Line: The internet continues to evolve. There seem to always be new methods, new ideas, new ways of doing things. This group will help all of us stay on top of the trends and, most importantly, have a bit of fun at the same time.
