results.description:
The New York City Enterprise Collaboration Meetup Group is dedicated to providing enterprise technologists, business people, analysts, and curiosity seekers thought leading information around Enterprise Collaboration. We focus on how business tools such as Yammer, Office 365, and Azure that are currently impacting the key issues corporations face:

• The bottom line

• User experience

• Minimal technical debt

• Compliance

Our presenters are the tech workers in the trenches deploying these solutions to the masses.

No sales pitches, little PowerPoint, just raw enterprise technology.

This meetup is ideal for the tech manager who actually manages the technology and wants the real scoop of the product.


Where tech reality meets the bottom line


Event sponsors: 

Soho Dragon-

SharePoint.  That is all we do.

We do more than just install SharePoint; we focus on the real issues like usability, adoption, content management, business process improvement, and security.  

After all, what good is a shiny new team site if people still email content around with version numbers in the filename?  That’s why we don’t just do the SharePoint plumbing; we also specialize in training, adoption and implementation strategy.


Cloud Strategies

You bring information technology into your company to help your people be more productive.  Sometimes, however, it feels like you spend more time focused on the technology than on growing your business.

CloudStrategies' goal is to make computing as easy and accessible as telephone or electrical service.  Plug and play.  With our cloud solutions, the same is true for your computers and devices.  Plug into the internet and gain immediate access to all the resources you need to get the job done.

You focus on your core business.  Let CloudStrategies and Microsoft focus on your email and collaboration…business-relevant solutions that your people need wherever, whenever and on whatever device they may be using.
results.name: New York City Enterprise Collaboration Meetup

results.description:
Convenience is King! We are experiencing a revolution enabled by new technologies and shifting consumer habits, spurring what we call "The On-Demand Economy." Mobile spending will represent the fastest and largest spend shift we have seen in history, and smartphones are quickly becoming the remote controls that allow us to navigate our daily lives. 

Together, lets discover, evaluate, and recognize the innovative new commerce companies that are helping to make our lives easier and more efficient!
results.name: The On-Demand Economy

results.description:
Like us on Facebook! 

You've done your homework. Your instrument is at its peak. You know the part, the lines, the emotion and the motivation. But do you feel you are you worthy of the part? Of course you are, however sometimes you might show up for the audition with a bit of doubt (fear? anxiety?) and telegraph that feeling to the casting director.

You wish you only thought about the best things that you offer, but you just aren't sure if you have what it takes; what they want; or even if you are worthy. Gene Hirschel, a master in the field of behavior consulting and shaping, will show you specialized techniques that break though your existing mental limitations. Gene doesn't just tell you how to effect these changes; he actually uses the most advanced behavior technologies to install new behaviors directly into your mind and body.

Gene Hirschel has been on TV, radio and taught at the School of Visual Arts as well as many top corporations. For the first time, he brings his amazing techniques to the acting community so you too can master this crucial step in stage and screen success -- and get the part!

Imagine after this seminar:

•Easily identify and connecting to the decision maker(s) at the audition

•Learning to gain a deep rapport with almost anyone!

 •Become an expert at automatically calling in confidence and using it. •Entering a room expecting the very best performance from yourself and then-- experiencing exactly that!

•Clearly picture and know in your heart that you are absolutely worthy and deserving of the part

•Learn how to "pre-charge" the room with positive outcome energy.

•Mentally re-map previous auditions in your past to create an unstoppable “audition machine”
results.name: Audition Mastery for NYC Actors - Are you audition worthy?

results.description:
We believe in fostering entrepreneurship by building communities of startup-minded people through social and business oriented events. NYC Entrepreneurs meets and hosts weekly and monthly events where entrepreneurs connect in a relaxed yet productive way. We meet for breakfast most Thursday mornings in midtown NYC and every THIRD (or fourth) THURSDAY of the month at a local restaurant/bar/pub.

We are going to be meeting for happy hour every month at Ainsworth Park - 6-8PM
111 East 18th Street @Park Ave South (ask for the meetup or Raphi Salem)

We can help you promote your company, services, generate leads and sell your products. We welcome  entrepreneurs, individual practitioners, salespeople and representatives of companies large and small. We promote businesses within the group, awareness of each others professions, and educate each other to help increase individual success. We grow our business through relationships, networking, and referrals. RSVP here: (Payment of $20.00 must be made in advance of all meetings via paypal here: http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA - or you can pay $25.00 at the door with cash or check. The $500.00 annual membership fee entitles you to exclusive membership with no competition.)

Schedule for 2015 (Thursdays)

Breakfast @AXA - 8:15-9:30
Lunch @Citrin Cooperman - 12:30-2PM
Happy Hours @Ainsworth Park - 6-8PM

Oct 8 & Lunch, 15 & Happy Hr, 22
Nov 12 & Lunch, 19 & Happy Hr, 26 is Thanksgiving (no mtg)
Dec 10 & Lunch, 17 & Happy Hr, 24

We have been around since 2000 and have generated millions of dollars in leads and closed business. We are primarily seasoned veterans but welcome young go-getters.

We are similar to many other groups in that we are a roundtable forum and everyone gets to give their :60 second pitch. But then we go deeper into your business in our "advisory" round where we dive into your business issues and act as your own personal advisory board.

We can help you:

- develop a sales plan

- develop a marketing plan

- with finances

- with HR issues

- secure speaking engagements

- become aware of other marketing and sales opportunities, trade shows and advertising mediums

- meet other key people and partners

- get more referrals!

Call Raphi Salem (212-222-3292) today to find out more or to RSVP for any of our monthly events.

Most events take place on Thursday mornings (the 2nd, 3rd and 4th Thursday of every month) at 8:15-9:30AM. Networking takes place from 8:15-8:30. The actual meeting and introductions are between 8:30 and 9:30. And then there is more networking after the meeting until 10AM. Once in a while we will gather for happy hour at a local bar, tavern, restaurant or lounge.

Cost: Annual Membership is $500. This entitles you to attend all meetings without having to pay the $20 per meeting fee. (Payment must be made in advance via paypal here:

http://bit.ly/1fDv0KA

) or to payments {at} salemglobal.com or $25/cash at the door.)

Sponsors: We are always looking for sponsors. Would you like to sponsor our group? Thank you to Paul Berkman of AXA Advisors for helping us secure the conference room for our meetup. He is the best in the business. Come on down to meet him!

Location: AXA Advisors

1290 Avenue of the Americas, 16th Floor


(You must RSVP in order to get on the security list)


We look forward to seeing you at our next Breakfast or other Networking event.


Raphi Salem (212-222-3292)

Raphi Salem
SalemGlobal Internet, Website Marketing & Lead Generation

results.description: This is a group for anyone passionate about Apple's Mac computer, technology reuse, and the burgeoning circular economy critical to our survival as a species. Planned obsolescence has never been more abundant in our society. This anti-consumer group examines the evolution of the Mac, and scrutinizes Apple's built in obsolescence strategies (how many new cables have you been forced to buy when upgrading?) You don't need to be an uber-geek to attend. All are welcome! I started this group because after nearly 20 years of working with Apple, I'm eager to share knowledge and discuss these topics. Looking forward to exploring these ideas and much more with everybody! Some group highlights: - Is Apple downgrading the Mac? - Innovative reuse and DIY - Sustainable product design

results.description:
This is a group for people who are looking for understanding (open minded) individuals to talk to. If you need to vent out and talk to someone or a group, then this is the place where you'll be heard. The members take an active role in acting as counselors and provide positive feedback and help guide members to taking steps to do better. We are all about being positive here for positive outcomes, so if your intention is to stay sad rather than progress then this is not the place for you. I started this group because when i was going through a very difficult time, i had no one to talk to, vent out or tell me that things were going to be OK. I suffered a great deal having to resolve many of these issues on my own, having to push myself out of depression was not easy. This group is made so that you don't have to go through the same thing and have someone who will listen. This group does not consist of therapist, social workers, or any type of mental health workers. just normal open minded people, willing to share their stories, listen to yours, and try our best to end things on a positive note.

You could be having a bad day or going through a rough period of time, if you need to vent out, this is a good place to try.
results.name: I need someone to talk to.

results.description:
“This is a bilingual group (English/Spanish) for anyone interested in improving their photography skills. The organizer will offer from time to time workshops in specific topics such as: The histograph, inverse square law, basic posing, depht of field, exposure triangle, flash photograhy, etc. 

This group will also meet in public places for practicing what we love, photography. When we meet, the members of the group will be given a specif task for that day. The idea here is to improve our skills step by step. The goal of the group is to learn from one another and to help each other during the shoots. 

To achieve the goal, the members of the group will be encouraged to socialize and to form small teams. Each team will have a task: One team, for example, can concentrate in depth of field and the other one can concentrate in composition. 

Each team will also have a leader. The leader will supervise and give instructions to the team on how to achieve the goal. 

 All skills levels are welcome. 

Let's make this work for us. Let's give each others a hand and at the same time learn from each other.

Tino

http://tinophotovideo.com

results.description:
Welcome to our new Community! 

Do you feel overwhelmed with trying to make healthy changes for you and your family?
Do you need that extra push to start eating healthy?

 If you are in need of motivation and support, join us and discover a unique approach to living your best life. We will provide you with the tools you need to make lasting changes in your life. 

I hope to be able to bring health and wellness to the forefront of people's lives.  If you are already a "health-guru" or you are just beginning your journey, this is a place to connect with people who are on that same path.  

This is about unearthing the skills you already possess and gaining the confidence to live your life to its fullest capacity. Our mantra is bio-individuality; that each person has unique food and lifestyle needs. 

Come and join us in an environment that is non-judgmental, warm and welcoming.  We will have lots of great workshops to encourage you, guide you and inspire you to integrate healthy habits into your lifestyle.  Join us as we begin our journey of transformation together!

results.description:
This is a group where artists can get together and we can share our work to get feedback from other artists. I am located in what is traditionally referred to as South Brooklyn (Cobble Hill, Downtown, Carroll Gardens, Red Hook, Gowanus, Park Slope, etc.) and am looking forward to meeting other artists and exchanging opinions and ideas with you. Meetings will be organized in the area, wherever it turns out appropriate for people to be able to bring their work for feedback. Ideas are welcome!

Members of the Meetup are expected to occasionally attend meetings.  I understand that we all have lives to live and people get busy, but people who sign up and never appear for a meeting with eventually be removed from the group.

<br> Personally, I am a painter with classical realist training. But artists from all media are welcome if you have something to share. Sculptors are welcome (if you can't bring it, bring pics)! Poets and musicians, come share your thoughts and work! 

 

One thing I ask is that members take RSVP'ing seriously.  Please let us know if you will not be coming to an event that you RSVP'ed "Yes" to. It is appreciated if you could just kindly reply "No" if you have no intention of coming to an event.  It just takes a second, and helps my planning.  Many thanks!

results.description: "Think Positive New York," founded by David Giller and Helene Abrams, is a grass-roots movement for like-minded individuals committed to accelerating positive change in communities throughout the New York region. This multi-platformed approach, now more than three decades in development, testing and implementation in Florida, California and New York, has the potential outreach to help all New Yorkers develop a positive mindset. The premise is simple: Surround everyone with positive reinforcements. Strategies and techniques are in place for people to think more positively, significantly reduce daily stress, and build self-esteem - from the very young to the very old. Programs and tools for individuals, schools, businesses, organizations, the City of New York agencies, institutions, etc. are now in place. The vehicles for doing this involve media projects, the internet, the arts and community programs. Meet-up members have a great opportunity to interact with this tribe in many areas of their lives.
results.name: Think Positive New York!

results.description:
Are you a twentysomething journalist / blogger / photographer / critic / social media guru? 

Want to know more twentysomething journalists / bloggers / photographers / critics / social media guruæ*? 

Then you've come to the right place! 

This group isn't about "networking." It's about getting to know the community of young journalists living, working, and covering New York City. Also drinking. Media people of all stripes are welcome!


Also, ICMYI, we're kind of a big deal on Facebook.


How to use this group

• Join one of our monthly meetups, special events, or propose your own!

• Share your articles, what you're working on, get feedback

• Ask questions, get advice, talk about what's new in news

• Debate the merits of the Oxford Comma 


Who can join?

• Working journalists, freelancers, journalism students, or anyone who's interested in meeting other young journalists in NYC


The groups's cover image is from the Census DotMap, an awesome example of data-driven journalism by The Cooper Center's Demographics Research Group.

*Not actually the plural of 'guru'
results.name: Young Journalists NYC

results.description: This is a Meetup for people currently working on globalization, internationalization and/or localization at tech and media companies in New York City. There will be regular round-table discussions where a small group of people will swap stories and share approaches for translations, payments, etc. If your job is focused on these issues, please join the Meetup. The TWIP - Travel With Interesting People Meetup group, is an opportunity for people to find like-minded travel partners for local, domestic, and international trips alike. We are all familiar with the difficulty in getting friends to commit to travel and aligning everyone's schedules (job responsibilities, going back to school, family/kids, etc.). This group is for those who know they want to travel, and they are looking for the who and where.

We host monthly gatherings and giveaways (from local sponsors) to connect fellow travelers, make new friends, and perhaps plan your next trip with others. We also put together local day excursions and domestic & international trips, which anyone is welcome to partake in. Our goal is to keep the enthusiasm of travel and camaraderie going strong.

results.description: This is a group for anyone who loves ragtime and traditional jazz. We'll be enjoying live music performances around New York city, particularly following a favorite ragtime piano player, Terry Waldo, a charismatic, long-time veteran of the genre. More info on Terry: Terry Waldo is considered one of America's premier performers and presenters of Ragtime and Early Jazz. Known for his virtuoso ragtime and stride piano playing, charming vocals, and disarming wit, he is the protégé‚ of the legendary Eubie Blake, who called Waldo "an extension of my own musical self." Waldo has played countless New York jazz clubs, including the legendary Cookery, Hanratty’s and Michaels’s Pub where he produced and starred in nine critically acclaimed musical revues. He has appeared in concerts worldwide, including the Grand Parade du Jazz in Venice, George Wein’s JVC Jazz Festival at Carnegie Hall and Jazz At Lincoln Center. He recently appeared with the New York Pops at Carnegie Hall where he performed the world premier of “The Eubie Blake Concerto.”
results.name: New York Ragtime & Traditional Jazz Music Meetup

This is a group for both musicians and fans of music alike. Genres include jazz, rock, pop, standards and more, with an emphasis on jazz.  We will have jam sessions for those who play or are learning to play, go to free live concerts, music workshops, Karaoke, open mic night, and anything else we can think of that is music related. All ages over 21 welcome. 

To join, you must upload a photo clearly showing your face, and answer the questions. If you cannot upload a photo of your face and/or answer the 2 simple questions, please do not join. We mean it!!! 

Membership and events are open to members and their guests over the age of 21. We do Not permit children at our events. (we drink a lot :-) )

As with any meetup site, our events get photographed and  some of the songs are videotaped. These photos and videos will be posted on various websites such as this one, Youtube, and more.  If you do not feel comfortable being seen by the other members of meetup.com, please do not join.

Drummers: Brushes only!!! We cannot tolerate drumsticks. Too loud. We mean this also!! 

Thank you.

results.description:
In this meet up group we will get together for improvisation workshops in New York City Area. Classes will be open to actors and non-actors, and will focus on a genius woman's improvisation technique; the grandmother of Improvisation; Viola Spolin. According to Spolin incorporating game playing into acting training will help actors to get out of their heads and release their creative free selves. So she created "Theater Games" which became the source of the improvisational comedy as we know today through improv groups, of TV shows like Saturday Night Live.

The meet up workshops will help us experience Spolin Games and her method to achieve physical awareness, spontaneity and ensemble building.

"We learn through experience and experiencing. No one teaches anyone anything." Viola Spolin
"My vision is a world of accessible intuition" Viola Spolin

www.spolinist.com/new-york
results.name: IMPROV 4 ALL

results.description:
Greetings!

Business owners, entrepreneurs, and business leaders! We are here to create the largest and most prestigious business club in New Jersey. Bringing businesses from every county in New Jersey to come together and network with each other.

One of the oldest and still one of the best ways to get new clients is by referrals. Another great way is meeting new people at gatherings. There is saying an old saying "Who you surround your self with, is what you become". 

Our vision, is to become one of the most prestigious business club in NJ. To have recognized and well established entrepreneurs speak and share with our group their successful  journey  in the business world today. Allowing business owners to grow their network, gain new connections with successful individuals, and share modern marketing tactics to increase clientele. 

We are a strong believer that you can achieve anything you want in life. All you need is passion, love and the determination to achieve your desires.  

Join us in this amazing journey, as we manifest our visions and passions together.

Best Regards,

New Jersey Business Club Team.

results.description:
The Women’s Center for Entrepreneurship helps elevate women to business success through education, consulting and entrepreneurial training. Serving women across New Jersey, the Center provides more than 150 classes, seminars and individual consulting sessions each year for more than 5,000 participants.

Our Business Growth Meetup is designed to help women who have been in business for a year or more gain the knowledge, tools and relationships that will be required to grow their companies to the next level.

All of our meetups will have a main speaker that will generally be the owner of a successful woman owned business.  We will have opportunities to pitch your business to the group, and we'll tackle a "business problem of the month".  We know how hard it is to run your own business.  Sometimes you feel alone and don't have all the answers, yet as the leader of the business, you can't let that show.  This meetup will give you access to other women who have been down the same road, and may eventually become your informal board of advisors.

If you are a woman business owner looking to grow your company, you should join our meetup!
results.name: Women's Center for Entrepreneurship's Meetup

results.description:
We are a group of positive people who meet weekly in central park for a free yoga class. Because we love the energy in the class, some weeks we extend the meetups with picnics where we bring our goodies,snacks and share with other group members.We do beach classes,too. We always have new members and beginners in classes as well as others who has been practicing for a quite good time. Everyone is welcome to the classes-yes, Every One !

I'm Umit, I'm a certified Yoga Instructor and Therapist. In a world where everybody wants to take something, I thought I can put some effort to balance the situation so I decided to start this group and give these completely free yoga classes. There are so many people who met yoga through this group and loved it in the first practice. I believe we all can make little changes to make this world nicer and more positive just with starting from the self.

This is a group for anyone interested in Yoga, meditation, wellness, self-improvement and discovering.

All ages are welcome, no flexibility or strength needed ! I started this group to help people figure how much  yoga can improve your health and wellness.

Yes, you will feel great after the practice :)

Yes, you will be much more flexible

Yes, you will get much more oxygen in Central park than you possibly get anywhere else in the city !

No, I don't charge anything for classes--it's free

Yes, we have a meet up every week, check out our schedule !

There is no limit for number of people who would like to attend ( I might just need to be miced up soon though)

Feel free to invite your friends, buddies, relatives-whoever you think he/she might be interested.

I currently teach at a few different Yoga studios in Manhattan and one of them is below:

http://urbanyogafoundation.org/teachers/

Come join one of our Central Park classes ! We would like to meet you and practice together.

You can also join us on Facebook and get the schedule for other free classes in NYC

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Free-Central...

Peace and Love to all!!

results.description:
The Relationship Circle

About the Relationship Circle:

The Relationship Circle is an open, honest and safe forum allowing individuals to explore their relationships with themselves and others, while creating community and connection.  The group focuses on relationships and how we relate to each other in the present moment: uncovering the patterns, context and strategies that keep us from being our whole selves in our intimate relationships.

We will dive deep and resurface with the treasures acquired during this process; start the hard work of shifting and transforming our relationships to create positive, healthy and satisfying relationships within our community of friends, family, work and romantic partners.

About Us:

The Relationship Circle began in Washington DC in September of 2011, led and founded by Relationship Coach Gregg DeMammos.  Since then, it has grown to a group with over 400 members meeting regularly to transform people's relationships and lives.  You can find out more about the origin of The Relationship Circle and read blog entries at www.relationshipcircle.com.

Eva Fernandez, is a licensed couples and family therapist (LMFT) Board Certified Coach (BCC).  She trained as a Life and Ontological coach at Accomplishment Coaching, an International Coach Federation (ICF) accredited school and is completing her ICF accreditation.

As a relationship coach and couples therapist, Eva has helped individuals, families, couples and groups break free from negative cycles and patterns that keep them from forming and sustaining loving and healthy relationships. She will be your guide on your journey to wholeness--empowering you to take control of your emotional health and discover how to create those loving and secure relationships we all crave.

My Philosophy:

We all want to be seen and heard--to express ourselves fully and authentically without being judged, shamed, criticized or rejected. Through the group process, you will learn to give yourself permission to express yourself fully in all aspects of your Self, to recognize the good and the healthy, while unraveling the strategies and contexts that keep you stuck. We will partner to uncover that which has been shunned or pushed to the dark and forgotten--those destructive behaviors and unfulfilling relationships that limit your emotional growth.

My way of being and working with you is warm, respectful, authentic, honest and compassionate. As a group facilitator, my role is to facilitate and move the conversation forward, while attending to the group process and your present moment awareness. The power of group lies in the unique opportunity to receive multiple perspectives, support, encouragement and feedback from other individuals in safe and confidential environment. These interpersonal interactions can provide group members an opportunity to deepen their level of self-awareness and to learn how they relate to others. The Relationship Circle can be a safe and supportive place to experiment with new ideas and ways of being. Together we work at creating a space where you can experience profound change rather than merely talking about change.

Group Format:

The format of the groups will often be topic-driven (structured) as a jumping off point to create powerful conversation.  Other times, group members are encouraged to bring in their relationship issues. 

· The group size is limited to 14-16 people

· This is an open group for men and women

NOTE: For those who are interested in deeper work, there is a closed-group that will be running on Wednesday, April 16th, 2014. This is a 12-week commitment group, limited participants of 8-10, harnessing the interpersonal interactions to deepen your interpersonal skills, self-awareness and learn to create deep and powerful connections in your personal and professional life. 




If you have any questions or would like to schedule an intake for this upcoming group, please email or call: Eva Fernandez, LMFT

call: 646.881.4608

E-mail: Info@InnerPathwaysMFT.com


Stay Connected!

Visit Us: at InnerPathwaysMFT.com

Follow Us: @Coach_Eva

Like Us: Facebook
results.name: NYC: The Relationship Circle

These methods have been practiced for centuries but are fairly new to the West: Some say because they are so very simple (and fun), yet quite profound and powerful, if they had been freely shared, they would not have been appreciated.  Curious? visit our website: www.TaoZenLife.info for even more information... results.description:
Analyzing data is crucial to building sustainable and smart cities globally. Smart City and Energy data analysis can enable energy efficiency, maximize building energy management and distributed resources, and ultimately help cities realize greener, more reliable energy use. However, valuable energy consumer data is not available due to privacy concerns (for individuals) and competitive value (for businesses).

This speaker series will tackle New York City’s toughest smart city and energy issues with the city’s data experts. They will take you on a journey through how they are using data to unlock value and benefit for all to make New York a stronger and more intelligent city.


Education, training, our Feature Event the Live Analytic, networking, and contests will be key components of the meetup in an effort to get more people excited and involved in smart cities, energy and data

Sponsored by the NYC Economic Development Corporation

topics.name: Studying for the Graduate Record Exam

results.description:
I have beaten the GRE many times. More importantly, I have helped hundreds of students beat the test without stressing out! If you need to take the GRE, I'm here to help! 

Each session will cover 1-3 of the following:

• Test-taking strategy

• Calculator tricks for the GRE

• Quantitative Comparison strategies

• Arithmetic (and how the GRE makes it hard!)

• Algebra

• Geometry and Coordinate Geometry

• Word Problems 

• Probability and combinatorics

• Standard deviation and stats

• Data Interpretation (charts and tables)

• Prime Numbers, Divisibility, and other "math logic" topics they don't teach you in school!

• Vocabulary Practice

• Strategy for Sentence Equivalence and Text Completion problems

• Reading Comprehension strategies

• Strategies especially for science passages in Reading Comp

• Logic rules and logic-based reading comp

• Issue Essay strategies and practice

• Argument Essay strategies and practice

• Test stress reduction


This group meets at 55 Broad Street (4/5 to Wall St or 2/3 to Wall St) or occasionally in South Slope, Brooklyn.

(Non-native speakers may also be interested in my other Meetup group, Advanced ESL with Jen Dziura.)

I hope to meet you soon!

About Me: I am the holder of a perfect GRE score and the author of two sets of vocabulary flashcards for the GRE, as well as portions of several other GRE , GMAT, and logic books. I have helped thousands of students over more than a decade of experience in the test prep world. I explain things clearly, and I'm pretty nice, if I do say so myself! I have helped GRE students who haven't done math since middle school, students who are struggling with English as a second language, and students taking the GRE for b-school or quantitative programs who need ultra-high scores. I was the first person in my family to go to college, so I understand the struggles of people who are trying hard to succeed.
results.name: Unlock the GRE with Perfect Scorer Jen Dziura

results.description:
Have you taken the most advanced ESL classes the city has to offer, but still don't feel ready to get that masters, MBA, or PhD? Do you feel like you speak and understand English too well for ESL classes, but not well enough to succeed on standardized tests?

I'm here to help! 

This group meets Sundays at 55 Broad Street (4/5 to Wall St or 2/3 to Wall St). Each 1.5 hour session includes 2-3 of the following:

Grammar lessons related to essay writing, beating standardized tests, and academic and business writing

Vocabulary lessons with emphasis on academic vocabulary that appears in textbooks, in business writing, and on standardized tests

Real-world editing -- a writing sample is provided or everyone writes a short composition, and we correct the passages for grammar, idioms, and cultural appropriateness.

Reading comprehension practice -- We read a selection from a standardized test or from a high-lexile publication such as The Economist, The New Yorker, etc., and answer questions that require the kind of close reading required for the GMAT and GRE, and for writing incisive academic essays.

Presentation and class participation practice -- Practice public speaking and speaking up in class.

This is not a test prep class, but would be very effective if taken concurrently with a test prep class, or prior to beginning your GRE/GMAT studies. (You may also be interested in my other Meetup group, Unlock the GRE with Perfect Scorer Jen Dziura.)

I hope to meet you soon!

About Me: I am the author of a grammar, logic, and reading comp book specifically for non-native speakers taking the GMAT (I even went to India to do research!) as well as two sets of vocabulary flashcards for the GRE. I'm also co-author of or contributor to more than ten other test prep books. I have perfect scores on the GRE and SAT, and a perfect 51 verbal on the GMAT. I have helped thousands of students over more than a decade of experience in the test prep world. I explain things clearly, and I'm pretty nice, if I do say so myself! I was the first person in my family to go to college, so I understand the struggles of people who are trying hard to succeed.
results.name: Advanced ESL with Jen Dziura

results.description:
Polynesian, Micronesian, Melanesian, and Hawaiian Social!

Aloha!  This is a social meetup group for Polynesians, Melanesians, Micronesians, Surfers, Hula Girls, Asians from the Islands, and Island hoppers.  If you are in Manhattan, New York, we want you to be a member of the ohana (Family).  Bring your boards, Aloha spirit, ukuleles, and polish the Tiki. 

We have our meetings in Manhattan, New York. We have at least one social event a month. We also host and attend Island art, cultural, and social functions.

We are going to host some trips to Florida and Polynesia, in order to experience authentic beach culture.

Surfers and non-Polynesians are welcome to join.

________________________________________________________________________

Polynesia - Micronesia - Melanesia

Price: Membership is FREE.

Time: Varies based on the activity.

Date: The event dates vary, but we are having a Polynesian Social event the first Saturday of every month.

Activities:  The activities include, but are not limited to;

• Art Receptions

• Beach Trips

• Business Networking

• Polynesian Cultural Events

• Huna Research

• Luaus

• Manhattan, New York Events

• Melanesian Cultural Events

• Micronesian Cultural Events

• Museum Trips

• Night Clubs

• Surf Trips

Place:  We are usually going to meet midtown in Manhattan, at a predetermined meeting location.  If you have any ideas or suggestions, let us know.


How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  We send directions via email to all attending members.
results.name: Hawaii Manhattan Surf

results.description:

The group is designed for Americans of Scandinavian and Germanic descent or Americans who have some Scandinavian or German ancestors, or people visiting America from Germany and Scandinavia.  The purpose of the group is to explore Scandinavian and Germanic culture in a social environment.  Americans interested in Scandinavian culture are welcome to join the group.  We are going to be attending Scandinavian cultural events throughout Manhattan, New York. We are also going to have a monthly social event the 1st Saturday of every month.

________________________________________________________________________

DENMARK - FAROE ISLANDS - FINLAND - GREENLAND - ICELAND - NORWAY - SWEDEN

Price: Membership is FREE.

Time: Varies based on the activity.

Date: The events dates vary, but we are having a Scandinavian social event the third Saturday of every month.

Activities:  The activities include, but are not limited to;

• American Scandinavian Foundation Events

• Art Receptions

• Boating Trips

• Christmas Events

• Danish Seaman's Church Service

• Finnish Seaman's Church Service

• Museum Outings

• Norwegian Seaman's Church Service

• Ski and Snowboard Trips

• Swedish Seaman's Church Service

Place: We are going to be meeting in many different locations, but we are usually going to be around Turtle Bay in Manhattan, New York.  Turtle Bay is a popular area in Manhattan.  Turtle Bay is an ideal location as it is near the American Scandinavian Foundation, The Swedish Seaman's Church, the Norwegian Seaman's Church, Grand Central Terminal, and a large number of night clubs.


How to find us:  We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  We send directions via email to all attending members.


WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO REMOVE ANY MEMBER FROM THIS GROUP AT ANYTIME!  ANY MEMBERS WHO WE BELIEVE TO BE FAKE OR WHO WE FEEL ARE CYBERSQUATTING ARE GOING TO BE REMOVED!

results.description:
Asian Fashion in New York:   This is a Meetup for the study and creation of Asian Fashion.  This meetup is for people interested in Asian fashion and the Asian fashion industry in New York!

This Meetup has a regular Asian Fashion Social Meetup, for social networking.  We also host Fashion Events such as our Asian Fashion in New York Fashion Show.  We are also going to have many side events and Fashion programs during the year.

WHO WE WANT TO JOIN:

• Asian Artists

• Asian Business Professionals

• Asian DJs

• Asian Fashion Designers

• Asian Makeup Artists

• Asian Models

• Asian Multimedia Artists

• Asian Writers (Fashion, Historical, and Social)

• People Interested in attending Fashion events and parties

• People and corporations interested in Sponsoring Fashion shows

• People who love Asian art

• Art Professionals interested in Asian Fashion

THE ASIAN FASHION IN NEW YORK FASHION SHOW!

The theme of all of our Fashion shows is Modern Geisha.  There are different artistic subthemes. Subtheme topics that have been suggested include; Angkor Wat, Tokyo by Night, The Hong Kong Blues, Kung Fu Thursdays.  The styles can be of any Asian culture, and do not have to be Japanese, but they need to match the Modern Geisha theme. shion shows a year.  The number is going to be based on demand.  The main Fashion Show of Asian Fashion in New York is going to be held in November of every year.

Price: Tickets to the fashion show in November cost $50.00 per person for the show and $30.00 per person for the party.  100% of the money from the fashion show goes to the managing of Asian Fashion in New York.  The money goes to hosting our meetings, and producing our events.  Any staff member of Asian Fashion in New York receives a VIP COMP +1, which is a free fashion show pass (COMP), a V.I.P. pass, and a free complimentary pass(+1) for a guest.  Any Asian Fashion in New York member who is staff and attends over 20 meetings receives a VIP COMP +2, which allows 2 guests instead of 1.

Date: The third Saturday in November.

Place: We are going to be having our Fashion Shows in three locations; Korea Town, Chinatown, and in Midtown, Manhattan.

Join the fashion fun!

We are easy to locate and meet in visible, public places.  We send directions via email to all attending members.
results.name: Asian Fashion in New York

results.description:
I created this group for young ladies like myself, all races, between the ages of 21-25, who want to enjoy life in NYC and what it has to offer. I am 24 years old, and it seems as though most young ladies my age are so overwhelmed with the everyday "stresses" of life (job, school, relationships, etc) that we forget to have fun. We will only be this age once in our lives. Soon these great years will be nothing more than a memory. I would like for all of us to go out to great restaurants, clubs (Pacha, Sutra,etc) , movies, hookah lounges, karaoke, drinks, zumba, dance classes, museums, beach outings (summertime is around the corner), and build meaningful friendships along the way. Like the song says, girls just wanna have!! 

Group/Membership Guidelines: PLEASE READ:

If you RSVP Yes, and do not show up on the day of the event WITHOUT notifying me hours or days ahead of time, you will be removed from the group.  It takes time to schedule these events, so it is greatly appreciated being notified ahead of time. Thanks in advance. 

Your attendance is appreciated and helps build great friendships with the other members of the group. We can't get to know you if you're not present lol 

Most events/meetups are held in Manhattan and within reasonable price range. However, I will schedule a few girls weekend getaway trips in the summer (Atlantic city, Virginia beach,etc) so please be aware that the price range will increase for travel,hotel,activities expenses. Each member is responsible for her own finances. 

Also, if you have a birthday coming up, let the group know. We would love to celebrate your special day with you!

Thanks for reading & can't wait to meet you.


NO Drama, Bad Attitudes, Negativity/Disrespect. It will not be tolerated and will result in revoking your membership from the group.
results.name: NYC Uptown Ladies (21-25 Yrs Old Only)

results.description:
Bajo el auspicio del Sindicato Nacional de Escritores, el Taller Hispanoamericano de Escritura ofrece sesiones intensivas de creación literaria íntegramente en español, todos los viernes de 6 a 9pm, en el salón de conferencias de la National Writers Union de Nueva York.


Los géneros del curso son cuento, microrrelato, aforismos, memorias y poesía. Contaremos periódicamente con invitados especiales quienes compartirán con los alumnos su particular manera de entender la literatura. 


Nuestra finalidad es enseñar algunas estrategias de redacción orientadas exclusivamente a la creación literaria, tanto en narrativa como en poesía. En el Taller Hispanoamericano de Escritura aprenderemos las técnicas necesarias para narrar un cuento de manera eficaz. Veremos la importancia de la fonética, la métrica en la poesía, la contundencia en los aforismos y la discreción en las memorias. El taller es eminentemente práctico, con ejercicios, lecturas e intercambios de textos entre lo integrantes para su análisis y posterior discusión.


Nuestros talleres intensivos están dirigidos a personas sin ninguna experiencia como a personas aficionadas a escribir. Tenemos el firme compromiso de ayudar a cada integrante en la lectura y crítica de sus propios escritos, y de guiarlos en el uso de las más variadas herramientas.
results.name: Sindicato Nacional de Escritores

results.description:
I'm striving to create/maintain a consistent, weekly "gathering" of competitive (but always cool, friendly, and fun) Magic the Gathering Players for 8-player drafts, casual one-on-one battles, and Swiss tournaments. Basically whatever format the group or players for that week decide we want to tackle.

Me and my friend Nicolai have spent a lot of time building and honing a pretty solid Cube (if you've never Cube Drafted before feel free to message me about it so I can tell you how much fun it is) to draft out of.

I usually host the meetup at the school where I work, in Union Square, in the conference room here. Ideally every week there would be 8 players gathering (pun intended) to draft out of the Cube and play a mini-tournament.

I've been experimented recently with "Team Drafting" which has proven to be a lot of fun. Basically that works with the 8 players splitting into two 4 player teams and then drafting and then helping each other strategizing deck builds.

I also want to mix things up with Constructed formats as well (most likely using Modern decks) or Standard draft days, depending on what everyone wants to do. 

Anyway...if you think you'd be interested join the group and lets play some Magic.
results.name: NYC: Magic the Gathering - Weekly Battles

topics.name: Support for Victims of Domestic Violence

results.description: Hello everyone my name is Antoinette I started this  group because in  2009 I got involved with an abusive man that I ended up marrying. I want to share my story and experiences with  other women out there who are or could be in the same situation I once was in. My goal is to support and help as many women as I possible  can If I only reach one woman to understand the dangers of an abusive relationship and from the devastating  effects abuse of any form can have on a woman ( I myself know this only too well) then I have accomplished something worth doing. Abuse ladies comes in many forms abusive men are also known as sociopath- narcissistic- antisocial sociopath) antisocial sociopath is what my ex- husband was actually diagnosed with when he was sent to prison. I would like everyone to bear in mind that regardless of what problems these men may have there is no excuse in anyway shape or form for their behavior or to abuse or mistreat another person in fact statistics have shown these men know exactly what they are doing and to who they are doing it to also that they are not capable of empathy or remorse statistics have proven that a very small- very small I empathize here percentage of abusive men change please keep that in mind.I have been through extensive therapy and still attend therapy once a week I have researched and read numerous books on abuse all kinds of abuse I have attended Many domestic violence meetings and groups I was asked to speak at a domestic violence benefit back in 2012- I will post my speech on the site- I do this because one it helps me to understand things on a different level regarding domestic violence , myself and the behavior of the abuser . SECOND it gives me the information and knowledge I need to help myself and other woman  before it could possibly be to late. I had another group located in Brooklyn before starting this one that actually went extremely well but I had gotten sick for a little while and  had to closed that group because I wasn't well enough to keep up with it. I have a GREAT amount of compassion-understanding and an anonymous passion to reach as many women as I can to help them realize abusive relationships are not normal or healthy in fact they are extremely dangerous not only just on a physical level but financially -Verbally and can be extremely emotionally devastating to the point where our self-worth and self-esteem are almost nonexistent everything I write here is because I have been through it and without support and the right people in your life it can be extremely hard to overcome it's sad to say but the truth is some people may never overcome what  they have been through but with support and the right people and knowledge we can heal. it has  been my experience that only people who have been through the same situation can really feel and understand our pain I remember I had two women in my last group one woman said to me he doesn't really abuse me he just hits me once in a while and calls me names another woman said and this is the woman I asked to leave my group said that it was okay for men to behave verbally or abusive because that's how she grew up and what her parents did and that it was excepted back then I do not agree with this at all please don't get me wrong I was not being mean or un sympathetic the woman I'm talking about is actually a friend of mine I tried to make her realize that this is not acceptable and that no one has the right to mistreat anyone then or now so I simply said if this is your beliefs  on this matter that it would be better if she didn't attend the group just for the fact that I did not want any woman or anyone to think that abuse is acceptable or okay She actually understood we are still friends but unfortunately she thinks it's okay for men as she puts it to get a little crazy and I believe for this reason she is not able to have a healthy stable relationships for long periods at a time I will always be there for her and love her very much I have faith that one day she will get it right I also might add that at times I let her know that she is welcome to attend the group to listen and learn. My story goes something like this and I'm sure a lot of women can relate I met my ex-husband Jeffrey in early 2009 Jeffrey was loving understanding very giving very caring told me all the things I wanted to hear At the time when I met Jeffrey I had just recently come out of a relationship it wasn't an abusive relationship just that the gentleman I was with who was actually a very  good man had gotten caught up with drugs wouldn't get help and I didn't want to be in that type of relationship that type of relationship isnt  abusive but it is however dysfunctional in my opinion okay back to Jeffrey it was only a few months before Jeffrey's true colors came through it  kind of started very saddle almost as if you wouldn't notice  it But I saw it from the start. at that time because of my own insecurities and self-esteem I chose to ignore it and pretend nothing was wrong  so what started  with verbal abuse neglect disrespect eventually ended in physical abuse I was verbally abused almost on a daily basis with some of the most cruel hurtful words I have ever heard if Jeffrey didn't get what he wanted or if you didn't act the way he thought you should be he became very angry and aggressive I should mention I hid Jeffrey and our relationship from my family for most of the time we were together why you might say? for one because I knew he was an abusive man But at that time I believed I loved him and didn't want anyone to say why don't you leave him get away from him I had so many insecurities and my self-esteem you couldn't pick up with  a shovel that in my head I thought it was better to be with him because my mind was telling me who would want you Antoinette as time went on the abuse got worse and worse verbal abuse constantly physical abuse to the point of a blackeye a dislocated shoulder many  bruises  lifting the mattress in the air while I was sleeping and throwing me off  the bed hitting the dresser against the wall which has now cost me several herniated disc standing and arguing with him one day he grabbed my feet well my ankles which caused me to land on my back and hit my head and causing more injuries now to my neck I remember for some reason a particular time that stands out in my head Jeffrey and I had just gotten married it was only two weeks after our marriage we had a huge fight and I threw him out and he went to stay in a hotel I found out months later he actually had an affair with a prostitute in that hotel I didn't know that at the time I took him back I let him came back home and  and he wanted to have sex So we had sex in the Middle of sex he decided to grab me and push me half out the window naked calling me a whore telling me I like it let everyone see the whore u are this was Jeffrey's way of humiliating me and getting back at me for throwing him out Jeffrey as most abusive man are extremely manipulating not to mention they can be very charming and that is how they are able to  get you to want them even more manipulating abusive men tend to look for vulnerable weak insecure unstable  women they are on the prowl for easy prey I'm sure some of you must be saying why would I put up with something like this but ladies and I'm sure a lot of you know there are many many reasons why women put up with abuse And one of the reasons for this  group is to bring out the points of why we put up with abuse recognize them understand the reasoning and put ourselves on a journey to healing there is more to my story and yes with a happy ending that I will talk about in our group meetings also this doesn't have to only be in groups one on one meetings are also available for women who are not comfortable yet talking in groups. For me the first step in  recognizing abuse was to admit there was abuse and to believe that I am worth more then to be mistreated  and to reach out for  help and support
results.name: Antoinette's -Self-Empowering Woman's Support Group

results.description:
Brooklyn Arts Council is proud to help nurture Brooklyn’s traditional artists and preserve our borough’s diverse heritage though our folk arts program. Our Brooklyn Folk Arts Meet-Ups extend our mission and activities into monthly face to face meetings, at various locales. Past meet-ups have focused on discussing ways to enhance folk arts presentations and grant applications and creating possibilities for cross-cultural and cross-genre collaborations.

Brooklyn Arts Council works with Brooklyn’s traditional artists and their immigrant communities to preserve and present arts expressive of the borough’s diverse living heritage—folk song, storytelling, social dance, foodways, material culture and more. BAC’s folk arts program is directed by a professional folklorist and associates trained in fieldwork techniques—interviewing, photographing, community engagement skills and collaborations. Fieldwork is part of every project that we undertake.
results.name: The Brooklyn Folk Arts Meetup

results.description:
The mission of our group is to organize fun and educational activities for those who want to encourage early multilingual education and social development among little ones. While the organizer is indeed a parent and many of the members are parents as well, we are not a "parents group" per se. In fact, we welcome anyone who wants to support children in positively shaping their spongy young minds by helping them to develop complex language neural pathways. Parents, brothers and sisters, extended family members, caretakers, or anyone else with a direct connection to a child who would be present at a Meetup event may certainly join.

As far as languages go, the organizer has some experience with Spanish, Mandarin, Cantonese, Farsi, and German. However, we don't want to limit ourselves. We hope to explore many diverse and rich languages including French, Japanese, Russian, Korean, Arabic, Portuguese, Italian, Dutch, Swedish, Akan (Twi), Fulani, American Sign Language (ASL), and more!

We would also like to invite members or "Multilinguals" who are more proficient in any language to assist us in developing ways to accurately incorporate useful words and phrases into our Meetups for the benefit of everyone. If you have a passion or an especially natural skill for languages and you want to pass said skill to younger generations, please join us!
results.name: Multilingual Families NYC

results.description: Hey ladies! This group is for women who enjoy a nice atmosphere when they go out. I created this group to build my network of girlfriends. I'm fortunate to have some really great friends, but often find myself without friends to do things with depending on work schedules, social scene preferences... etc. Things I'd like this group to do together include going out dancing in meatpacking, happy hours, boozy brunch, dinners... etc. I'm in my late 20s and think this group is best suited for women in their late 20s to mid-30s.
results.name: Girls who dislike dive bars (late 20s - mid 30s)

results.description:
The most important thing in business is– Think and grow rich.

Professional women owned business group is a great place for professional women in business to share/receive information on growing and or maintaining your current business. This is a great place to meet other like-minded women that you can refer business to and gain additional business for your business.

This group was developed for the busy professional women that is 150% focus on building & growing their already established business.

Requirements: 

• You must own your own business or businesses

• You must have revenue in your business

• You must always be in business attire for every meeting

Things to expect!

*Growth to your business
*Knowledge
*Professional friendship
*Amazing connection
*Powerful women in business
results.name: Professional Women Owned Business Group

results.description:
There is a break in our calendar July 15-27, 2015 because we will be teaching two calisthenics seminars in Ireland. Normal class schedule will resume starting with July 28 "Rise n Grind". 

Hey! Are you into bodyweight training aka calisthenics aka Street Workout? Check out our classes! We teach calisthenics in a motivating, inspiring, and fun group environment. Every class uses fun and demanding routines that will push your limits of strength and endurance. The group setting adds further challenges to the workout while offering encouragement and camaraderie between everyone involved. All classes are designed for ALL LEVELS to participate, so whether you're just starting to workout or are looking to break a muscle up world record, you've come to the right place. 

In the meantime check out some of our video material: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8rmkzTzHSqI and  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uPYDl11ZGCQ 

We meet every Tuesday@7:00am, Thursday@6:30pm, and Saturday@11:00am at the Tompkins Square Park fitness equipment (10th St. and Ave. B).  All classes are taught by both Mark Leitz (M.S Phys. Ed.) and Rick Seedman (ACE cert.), who have taught seminars, workshops, and classes in places such as Los Angeles, U.K, Ireland, Switzerland, and Norway in addition to having competed internationally. Walk ups are always welcome but of course we appreciate rsvp's! 

If you have any questions please feel free to contact us here or email us at MRCalisthenics@gmail.com 

...and visit/like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MRCalisthenics
results.name: MR Calisthenics

results.description: This is a meetup for those interested in Electronic Music such as Moombhaton, Dubstep, House, Trap, Electro, Zouk, Techno etc etc etc. We'll be organizing events with local DJ's and producers in the above mentioned genres. So if you like the idea, join us!!!

results.description:
Internet Club is for developers, by developers. We're interested in cultivating conversation on open web technologies for the 1337 and cross-browser curious. 

We host monthly tech talks on topics from the front to back (end), and an occasional hackathon.
results.name: Internet Club NYC

results.description:
BACKGROUND

In the late 1800’s the Palisades, now a National Natural Monument (June 1983) were under threat of extinction. They were saved by New Jersey’s Governor Foster M. Voorhees, New York’s Governor Theodore Roosevelt and the NJ State Federation of Women’s Clubs. These visionaries had the foresight to preserve this truly remarkable gem of nature that was formed 200 million years ago. 

An informative video  https://vimeo.com/97688891

This group is intended as a vehicle for members that support conservation of the Palisades.
results.name: Protect the Palisades

results.description: Looking for a way to grow your business? Try referral based marketing. Imagine having 20, 30, 40 sales people each and every week listening for the language of referrals for YOU and YOUR BUSINESS. It is called net-WORK-ing for a reason though, you have to work at it, be consistent, be present. People buy from people they know, like and trust.
results.name: BNI Networkers Choice Chapter Florham Park NJ

results.description:
Do you like to bike, practice yoga, check out amazing bars and restaurants, go camping and hiking, be active and generally explore the more authentic, off-the-beaten path side of NYC and beyond? Do you also want to meet other cool, like-minded and fun people who share these interests?

If you answered yes to any of these than we invite you to join our Urban Adventurers Meetup here in NYC by Get Up and Ride. We'll be organizing multiple excursions throughout the week that celebrate living mindfully and kicking-ass in the city! Here's a few ideas of what we have in mind: 

• A BYOB (bring your own bike) ride that starts with yoga on a rooftop or park than rides along Brooklyn's waterfront and tours an urban rooftop farm then ends with pizza by the Brooklyn Bridge! 

• A small supper club dinner where we bring a professional chef to prepare a catered farm-to-table dinner bbq! 

• Bike ride followed by beach volleyball at Brooklyn Bridge Park, enjoy a picnic lunch then bike back for drinks at a North Brooklyn rooftop bar! 

Those are just a few ideas of what we can do and we'll be proactively seeking the feedback of the community. Don't have a bike? No problem, we'd be happy to rent one out to you.
results.name: Urban Adventurers Meetup in NYC by Get Up and Ride

results.description: Local actors will take you on a fascinating walking tour of several Greenwich Village bars taht are rich with literary history. Inside each bar, you'll relax and have time for a drink as your tour guides weave fantastic tales of some of the greatest and most influential authors who have frequented these pubs, share stories of the village, and recite passages from their work. Enjoy the legends, walk the streets, and hear the work. One of the best tours in NYC.
results.name: Greenwich Village Literary Pub Crawl

results.description: We are an eclectic bunch who like whisk(e)y and/or wine, enjoy talking about them, learning new things, share their knowledge, and of course trying new whisk(e)ys and wines from all over the world.
results.name: Westchester Whisk(e)y and Wine Afficionados

results.description: This is a meetup for NYC users of Spark (www.spark-project.org), the high-speed Scala-based cluster programming framework. We'll be rotating among locations in New York City. We'll also discuss other Spark-related projects, including the Hive-on-Spark port (Shark), and other new programming tools for big data. The meetup will include introductions to the various Spark features, case studies from current users, best practices for deployment and tuning, and future development plans.
results.name: Spark-NYC

results.description:
A group for people who want to make friends with their neighbors. Great for people who live off Jefferson, Dekalb, and Myrtle-Wyckoff. The idea is that we're all a walking distance from each other, but anyone is welcome to join if you're willing to make the trek. We meet up a couple times a month for happy hour with some events in between.

If you're thinking of joining (yes you should join!), please have a photo of your lovely face up and make a quick intro. This is to make sure you're not a bot or a sales person trying to market something to the group.

results.description: A meetup for active, passive and aspiring pilots, including aviation enthusiasts and world travelers balancing city life, family and a passion for aviation: useful and inspiring talks around aviation, the practical aspects of flying, how to best use technology, how stay sharp and become better as a pilot, how to get started, how to get back into it, keep up with regulations, address logistical challenges of living in the city, share resources,  how to plan a flying vacation. Balance urban life, family and aviation.

results.description:
NY Tech Tank is a think tank that focuses to foster technologists, entrepreneurs, investors and the broader innovation community and ensure the ongoing success of their tech efforts.

No Policy No Politics But Pure Tech.

NY TECH TANK is sponsored by NY STATE  DEPTT FOR SMALL BUSINESS AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP.

It provides programs, expertise and resources designed to accelerate the development of entrepreneurs and their resulting technology start-ups. At its premier business and technology events you can expect to see brain storming sessions, open discussions, expert panels, guest speakers & demos. These meetings are a great place to discover connections, new people and possible co-workers.

results.description:
Garden State Cheetahs is a running group that promotes these three goals.

Fitness for all: Whether you are a beginner or an experienced runner, you will find a place here. Several of our runners started running for the first time in their lives with us. Several of the charter members that trained with the group have completed multiple half marathons. We also encourage family members and kids to join us for the 5Ks that accompany half marathons, making this a fun family event.

Make it fun: You will be training with easy going, friendly fellow runners. You will only compete with yourself. The group will motivate you as much as you will motivate everyone else in the group. Apart from running, we also do a variety of fun and adventurous activities like kayaking, biking, obstacle races, hiking, river rafting, skiing, etc... 

Good to the bones: We use one of the events we participate in, as a fundraiser and donate the money for a good cause. In October 2013, about 50 members participated in Ocean City Half Marathon and 5K and raised over $5,500. The proceeds are used to help schools in India.
results.name: Garden State Cheetahs

results.description: Calling all Moms seeking or in a full or part time work situation, while raising young kids! Let's get together to offer mutual support and ideas on how to keep everyone - including our families and bosses - happy -- Not to mention our selves!! We can meet at my home, the park, the Cove, for coffee.. Whatever works, whenever works!

results.description:
Strollercize offers classes five days a week and on Saturdays during the Fall and Spring season. Moms can start when the doctor gives them the OK! Learn how to drive your stroller safely and get a Push on Fitness. We are the original stroller fitness program created by Elizabeth Trindade in 1995 in Central Park. Paul Shelby is a Strollercize Certified Instructor and runs the East Coast training division for Moms. Shelby's classes are Uptown in Central Park. Some Classes start at Polarn O. Pyret on the Upper West Side and at Giggle on the Upper East Side. More info is on our Website for schedule, membership fees and Our New On-Line  A Fit Mom Club! www.strollercize.com

http://youtu.be/VTUldkzC5R4

                        Check Out our Website for schedule and Membership Fees! www.strollercize.com
results.name: Strollercize® New York City
